title: NIST 800-53 Rev. 4 - Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations
description:
This publication provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for information systems and organizations to protect organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats and risks, including hostile attacks, human errors, natural disasters, structural failures, foreign intelligence entities, and privacy risks.

fb81fb1c-165e-43a4-8264-1dfd3182b630http://dx.doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r4
abstract: This publication provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems and organizations and a process for selecting controls to protect organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats including hostile cyber attacks, natural disasters, structural failures, and human errors (both intentional and unintentional). The security and privacy controls are customizable and implemented as part of an organization-wide process that manages information security and privacy risk. The controls address a diverse set of security and privacy requirements across the federal government and critical infrastructure, derived from legislation, Executive Orders, policies, directives, regulations, standards, and/or mission/business needs. The publication also describes how to develop specialized sets of controls, or overlays, tailored for specific types of missions/business functions, technologies, or environments of operation. Finally, the catalog of security controls addresses security from both a functionality perspective (the strength of security functions and mechanisms provided) and an assurance perspective (the measures of confidence in the implemented security capability). Addressing both security functionality and assurance helps to ensure that information technology component products and the information systems built from those products using sound system and security engineering principles are sufficiently trustworthy.
keywords: FIPS Publication 200; FISMA; Privacy Act; Risk Management Framework; security controls; FIPS Publication 199; security requirements; computer security; assurance;

securityControls.title: ac-1 - Access Control Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ac-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.1}} - An access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls; and
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.b.1}} - Access control policy {{ ac-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.b.2}} - Access control procedures {{ ac-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ac-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents an access control policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the access control policy are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the access control policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access control controls;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ac-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current access control policy;
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current access control policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ac-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current access control procedures; and
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current access control procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: ac-2 - Account Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.a}} - Identifies and selects the following types of information system accounts to support organizational missions/business functions: {{ ac-2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.b}} - Assigns account managers for information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.c}} - Establishes conditions for group and role membership;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.d}} - Specifies authorized users of the information system, group and role membership, and access authorizations (i.e., privileges) and other attributes (as required) for each account;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.e}} - Requires approvals by {{ ac-2_prm_2 }} for requests to create information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.f}} - Creates, enables, modifies, disables, and removes information system accounts in accordance with {{ ac-2_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.g}} - Monitors the use of information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.h}} - Notifies account managers:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.1}} - When accounts are no longer required;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.2}} - When users are terminated or transferred; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.3}} - When individual information system usage or need-to-know changes;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.i}} - Authorizes access to the information system based on:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.1}} - A valid access authorization;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.2}} - Intended system usage; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.3}} - Other attributes as required by the organization or associated missions/business functions;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.j}} - Reviews accounts for compliance with account management requirements {{ ac-2_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.k}} - Establishes a process for reissuing shared/group account credentials (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group.
  • ID: {{ac-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

      • objective: {{ac-2.a_obj.2}} - identifies and selects organization-defined information system account types to support organizational missions/business functions;

    • objective: {{ac-2.e_obj}}

    • objective: {{ac-2.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-2.f_obj.1}} - defines procedures or conditions to:

ac-3.2 - Dual Authorization

  • ID: {{ac-3.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:

securityControls.title: ac-3.3 - Mandatory Access Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system enforces {{ ac-3.3_prm_1 }} over all subjects and objects where the policy:
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.a}} - Is uniformly enforced across all subjects and objects within the boundary of the information system;
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b}} - Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.1}} - Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.2}} - Granting its privileges to other subjects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.3}} - Changing one or more security attributes on subjects, objects, the information system, or information system components;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.4}} - Choosing the security attributes and attribute values to be associated with newly created or modified objects; or
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.5}} - Changing the rules governing access control; and
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.c}} - Specifies that {{ ac-3.3_prm_2 }} may explicitly be granted {{ ac-3.3_prm_3 }} such that they are not limited by some or all of the above constraints.
  • ID: {{ac-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.1}} - the organization defines mandatory access control policies to be enforced over all subjects and objects;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.2}} - the organization defines subjects over which organization-defined mandatory access control policies are to be enforced;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.3}} - the organization defines objects over which organization-defined mandatory access control policies are to be enforced;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.4}} - the organization defines subjects that may explicitly be granted privileges such that they are not limited by the constraints specified elsewhere within this control;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.5}} - the organization defines privileges that may be granted to organization-defined subjects;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.6}} - the information system enforces organization-defined mandatory access control policies over all subjects and objects where the policy specifies that:
      • objective: {{ac-3.3.a_obj.6}} - the policy is uniformly enforced across all subjects and objects within the boundary of the information system;
      • objective: {{ac-3.3.b_obj.6}} - a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following:
        • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.1_obj.6}} - passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects;
        • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.2_obj.6}} - granting its privileges to other subjects;
        • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.3_obj.6}} - changing one or more security attributes on:
          • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.3_obj.6.a}} - subjects;
          • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.3_obj.6.b}} - objects;
          • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.3_obj.6.c}} - the information system; or
          • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.3_obj.6.d}} - system components;
        • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.4_obj.6}} - choosing the security attributes and attribute values to be associated with newly created or modified objects; or
        • objective: {{ac-3.3.b.5_obj.6}} - changing the rules governing access control; and
      • objective: {{ac-3.3.c_obj.6}} - organization-defined subjects may explicitly be granted organization-defined privileges such that they are not limited by some or all of the above constraints.


  • Guidance
    • #ac-25, related
    • #sc-11, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-3.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined mandatory access control policy
{{ac-3.3_prm_2}}: organization-defined subjects
{{ac-3.3_prm_3}}: organization-defined privileges (i.e., they are trusted subjects)
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms implementing mandatory access control

securityControls.title: ac-3.4 - Discretionary Access Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system enforces {{ ac-3.4_prm_1 }} over defined subjects and objects where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following:
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.a}} - Pass the information to any other subjects or objects;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.b}} - Grant its privileges to other subjects;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.c}} - Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the information system, or the information system’s components;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.d}} - Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects; or
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.e}} - Change the rules governing access control.
  • ID: {{ac-3.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:

securityControls.title: ac-7 - Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-7_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{ac-7_smt.a}} - Enforces a limit of {{ ac-7_prm_1 }} consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a {{ ac-7_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{ac-7_smt.b}} - Automatically {{ ac-7_prm_3 }} when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.
  • ID: {{ac-7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-7.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines the number of consecutive invalid logon attempts allowed to the information system by a user during an organization-defined time period;
      • objective: {{ac-7.a_obj.2}} - the organization defines the time period allowed by a user of the information system for an organization-defined number of consecutive invalid logon attempts;
      • objective: {{ac-7.a_obj.3}} - the information system enforces a limit of organization-defined number of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines account/node lockout time period or logon delay algorithm to be automatically enforced by the information system when the maximum number of unsuccessful logon attempts is exceeded;
      • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj.2}} - the information system, when the maximum number of unsuccessful logon attempts is exceeded, automatically:
        • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj.2.a}} - locks the account/node for the organization-defined time period;
        • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj.2.b}} - locks the account/node until released by an administrator; or
        • objective: {{ac-7.b_obj.2.c}} - delays next logon prompt according to the organization-defined delay algorithm.

    • #ac-9, related
    • #ac-14, related

securityControls.title: ac-8 - System Use Notification
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{ac-8_smt.a}} - Displays to users {{ ac-8_prm_1 }} before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance and states that:
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.1}} - Users are accessing a U.S. Government information system;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.2}} - Information system usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.3}} - Unauthorized use of the information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties; and
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.4}} - Use of the information system indicates consent to monitoring and recording;
    • item: {{ac-8_smt.b}} - Retains the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the information system; and
    • item: {{ac-8_smt.c}} - For publicly accessible systems:
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.1}} - Displays system use information {{ ac-8_prm_2 }}, before granting further access;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.2}} - Displays references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities; and
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.3}} - Includes a description of the authorized uses of the system.
  • ID: {{ac-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-8.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-8.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines a system use notification message or banner to be displayed by the information system to users before granting access to the system;
      • objective: {{ac-8.a_obj.2}} - the information system displays to users the organization-defined system use notification message or banner before granting access to the information system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance, and states that:
        • objective: {{ac-8.a.1_obj.2}} - users are accessing a U.S. Government information system;
        • objective: {{ac-8.a.2_obj.2}} - information system usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit;
        • objective: {{ac-8.a.3_obj.2}} - unauthorized use of the information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties;
        • objective: {{ac-8.a.4_obj.2}} - use of the information system indicates consent to monitoring and recording;
    • objective: {{ac-8.b_obj}} - the information system retains the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the information system;
    • objective: {{ac-8.c_obj}} - for publicly accessible systems:
      • objective: {{ac-8.c.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-8.c.1_obj.1}} - the organization defines conditions for system use to be displayed by the information system before granting further access;
        • objective: {{ac-8.c.1_obj.2}} - the information system displays organization-defined conditions before granting further access;
      • objective: {{ac-8.c.2_obj}} - the information system displays references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities; and
      • objective: {{ac-8.c.3_obj}} - the information system includes a description of the authorized uses of the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ac-10 - Concurrent Session Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-10_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system limits the number of concurrent sessions for each {{ ac-10_prm_1 }} to {{ ac-10_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{ac-10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-10_obj.1}} - the organization defines account and/or account types for the information system;
    • objective: {{ac-10_obj.2}} - the organization defines the number of concurrent sessions to be allowed for each organization-defined account and/or account type; and
    • objective: {{ac-10_obj.3}} - the information system limits the number of concurrent sessions for each organization-defined account and/or account type to the organization-defined number of concurrent sessions allowed.

securityControls.title: ac-11 - Session Lock
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-11_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{ac-11_smt.a}} - Prevents further access to the system by initiating a session lock after {{ ac-11_prm_1 }} of inactivity or upon receiving a request from a user; and
    • item: {{ac-11_smt.b}} - Retains the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.
  • ID: {{ac-11_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-11.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-11.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines the time period of user inactivity after which the information system initiates a session lock;
      • objective: {{ac-11.a_obj.2}} - the information system prevents further access to the system by initiating a session lock after organization-defined time period of user inactivity or upon receiving a request from a user; and
    • objective: {{ac-11.b_obj}} - the information system retains the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

• ID: {{ac-12.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{ac-12.1_smt.a}} - Provides a logout capability for user-initiated communications sessions whenever authentication is used to gain access to {{ ac-12.1_prm_1 }}; and

ac-16 - Security Attributes
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-16_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-16_smt.a}} - Provides the means to associate {{ ac-16_prm_1 }} having {{ ac-16_prm_2 }} with information in storage, in process, and/or in transmission;
    • item: {{ac-16_smt.b}} - Ensures that the security attribute associations are made and retained with the information;
    • item: {{ac-16_smt.c}} - Establishes the permitted {{ ac-16_prm_3 }} for {{ ac-16_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ac-16_smt.d}} - Determines the permitted {{ ac-16_prm_5 }} for each of the established security attributes.
  • ID: {{ac-16_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.1}} - defines types of security attributes to be associated with information:
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.1.a}} - in storage;
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.1.b}} - in process; and/or
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.1.c}} - in transmission;
      • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.2}} - defines security attribute values for organization-defined types of security attributes;
      • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.3}} - provides the means to associate organization-defined types of security attributes having organization-defined security attribute values with information:
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.3.a}} - in storage;
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.3.b}} - in process; and/or
        • objective: {{ac-16.a_obj.3.c}} - in transmission;
    • objective: {{ac-16.b_obj}} - ensures that the security attribute associations are made and retained with the information;
    • objective: {{ac-16.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-16.c_obj.1}} - defines information systems for which the permitted organization-defined security attributes are to be established;
      • objective: {{ac-16.c_obj.2}} - defines security attributes that are permitted for organization-defined information systems;
      • objective: {{ac-16.c_obj.3}} - establishes the permitted organization-defined security attributes for organization-defined information systems;
    • objective: {{ac-16.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-16.d_obj.1}} - defines values or ranges for each of the established security attributes; and
      • objective: {{ac-16.d_obj.2}} - determines the permitted organization-defined values or ranges for each of the established security attributes.

securityControls.title: ac-16.1 - Dynamic Attribute Association

    • objective: {{ac-16.1_obj.2}} - the organization defines security policies requiring the information system to dynamically associate security attributes with organization-defined subjects and objects; and
    • objective: {{ac-16.1_obj.3}} - the information system dynamically associates security attributes with organization-defined subjects and objects in accordance with organization-defined security policies as information is created and combined.

ac-19.4 - Restrictions for Classified Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-19.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.a}} - Prohibits the use of unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing information systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information unless specifically permitted by the authorizing official; and
    • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b}} - Enforces the following restrictions on individuals permitted by the authorizing official to use unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing information systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information:
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.1}} - Connection of unclassified mobile devices to classified information systems is prohibited;
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.2}} - Connection of unclassified mobile devices to unclassified information systems requires approval from the authorizing official;
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.3}} - Use of internal or external modems or wireless interfaces within the unclassified mobile devices is prohibited; and
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.4}} - Unclassified mobile devices and the information stored on those devices are subject to random reviews and inspections by {{ ac-19.4_prm_1 }}, and if classified information is found, the incident handling policy is followed.
    • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.c}} - Restricts the connection of classified mobile devices to classified information systems in accordance with {{ ac-19.4_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{ac-19.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-19.4.a_obj}} - prohibits the use of unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing information systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information unless specifically permitted by the authorizing official;
    • objective: {{ac-19.4.b_obj}} - enforces the following restrictions on individuals permitted by the authorizing official to use unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing information systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information:
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.1_obj}} - connection of unclassified mobile devices to classified information systems is prohibited;
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.2_obj}} - connection of unclassified mobile devices to unclassified information systems requires approval from the authorizing official;
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.3_obj}} - use of internal or external modems or wireless interfaces within the unclassified mobile devices is prohibited;
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.4_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.4_obj.1}} - defines security officials responsible for reviews and inspections of unclassified mobile devices and the information stored on those devices;
        • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.4_obj.2}} - unclassified mobile devices and the information stored on those devices are subject to random reviews/inspections by organization-defined security officials;
        • objective: {{ac-19.4.b.4_obj.3}} - the incident handling policy is followed if classified information is found;
    • objective: {{ac-19.4.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.c_obj.1}} - defines security policies to restrict the connection of classified mobile devices to classified information systems; and
      • objective: {{ac-19.4.c_obj.2}} - restricts the connection of classified mobile devices to classified information systems in accordance with organization-defined security policies.


  • Guidance
    • #ca-6, related
    • #ir-4, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-19.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined security officials
{{ac-19.4_prm_2}}: organization-defined security policies
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms prohibiting the use of internal or external modems or wireless interfaces with mobile devices

securityControls.title: ac-20 - Use of External Information Systems
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-20_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to:
    • item: {{ac-20_smt.a}} - Access the information system from external information systems; and
    • item: {{ac-20_smt.b}} - Process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems.
  • ID: {{ac-20_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization establishes terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to:
    • objective: {{ac-20.a_obj}} - access the information system from the external information systems; and
    • objective: {{ac-20.b_obj}} - process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems.

securityControls.title: ac-20.1 - Limits On Authorized Use
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-20.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization permits authorized individuals to use an external information system to access the information system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only when the organization:
    • item: {{ac-20.1_smt.a}} - Verifies the implementation of required security controls on the external system as specified in the organization’s information security policy and security plan; or
    • item: {{ac-20.1_smt.b}} - Retains approved information system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external information system.
  • ID: {{ac-20.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization permits authorized individuals to use an external information system to access the information system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only when the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-20.1.a_obj}} - verifies the implementation of required security controls on the external system as specified in the organization’s information security policy and security plan; or
    • objective: {{ac-20.1.b_obj}} - retains approved information system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external information system.

securityControls.assessmentPlan:

securityControls.title: ac-21 - Information Sharing
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-21_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-21_smt.a}} - Facilitates information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to the sharing partner match the access restrictions on the information for {{ ac-21_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ac-21_smt.b}} - Employs {{ ac-21_prm_2 }} to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions.
  • ID: {{ac-21_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-21.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-21.a_obj.1}} - defines information sharing circumstances where user discretion is required;
      • objective: {{ac-21.a_obj.2}} - facilitates information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to the sharing partner match the access restrictions on the information for organization-defined information sharing circumstances;
    • objective: {{ac-21.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-21.b_obj.1}} - defines automated mechanisms or manual processes to be employed to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions; and
      • objective: {{ac-21.b_obj.2}} - employs organization-defined automated mechanisms or manual processes to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions.


  • Guidance
    • #ac-3, related

  • {{ac-21.2}} - Information Search and Retrieval

  • ID: {{ac-21.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:

securityControls.title: ac-22 - Publicly Accessible Content
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-22_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-22_smt.a}} - Designates individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible information system;
    • item: {{ac-22_smt.b}} - Trains authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information;
    • item: {{ac-22_smt.c}} - Reviews the proposed content of information prior to posting onto the publicly accessible information system to ensure that nonpublic information is not included; and
    • item: {{ac-22_smt.d}} - Reviews the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information {{ ac-22_prm_1 }} and removes such information, if discovered.
  • ID: {{ac-22_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-22.a_obj}} - designates individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible information system;
    • objective: {{ac-22.b_obj}} - trains authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information;
    • objective: {{ac-22.c_obj}} - reviews the proposed content of information prior to posting onto the publicly accessible information system to ensure that nonpublic information is not included;
    • objective: {{ac-22.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-22.d_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information;
      • objective: {{ac-22.d_obj.2}} - reviews the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information with the organization-defined frequency; and
      • objective: {{ac-22.d_obj.3}} - removes nonpublic information from the publicly accessible information system, if discovered.

Parameters

• Assessment

      • Automated mechanisms implementing management of publicly accessible content

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-24_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes procedures to ensure {{ ac-24_prm_1 }} are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement.

securityControls.description:

securityControls.description:

  • ID: {{ac-24.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:

securityControls.title: ac-25 - Reference Monitor
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-25_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system implements a reference monitor for {{ ac-25_prm_1 }} that is tamperproof, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing, the completeness of which can be assured.

    • item: {{au-2_smt.b}} - Coordinates the security audit function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to enhance mutual support and to help guide the selection of auditable events;
    • item: {{au-2_smt.c}} - Provides a rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents; and
    • item: {{au-2_smt.d}} - Determines that the following events are to be audited within the information system: {{ au-2_prm_2 }}.

    • objective: {{au-2.b_obj}} - coordinates the security audit function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to enhance mutual support and to help guide the selection of auditable events;
    • objective: {{au-2.c_obj}} - provides a rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents;
    • objective: {{au-2.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{au-2.d_obj.1}} - defines the subset of auditable events defined in AU-2a that are to be audited within the information system;

securityControls.title: au-5 - Response to Audit Processing Failures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{au-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{au-5_smt.a}} - Alerts {{ au-5_prm_1 }} in the event of an audit processing failure; and
    • item: {{au-5_smt.b}} - Takes the following additional actions: {{ au-5_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{au-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{au-5.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{au-5.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines the personnel or roles to be alerted in the event of an audit processing failure;
      • objective: {{au-5.a_obj.2}} - the information system alerts the organization-defined personnel or roles in the event of an audit processing failure;
    • objective: {{au-5.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{au-5.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines additional actions to be taken (e.g., shutdown information system, overwrite oldest audit records, stop generating audit records) in the event of an audit processing failure; and
      • objective: {{au-5.b_obj.2}} - the information system takes the additional organization-defined actions in the event of an audit processing failure.


  • Guidance

    • #si-12, related

securityControls.title: au-5.1 - Audit Storage Capacity
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{au-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system provides a warning to {{ au-5.1_prm_1 }} within {{ au-5.1_prm_2 }} when allocated audit record storage volume reaches {{ au-5.1_prm_3 }} of repository maximum audit record storage capacity.
  • ID: {{au-5.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.1}} - the organization defines:
      • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.1.a}} - personnel to be warned when allocated audit record storage volume reaches organization-defined percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity;
      • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.1.b}} - roles to be warned when allocated audit record storage volume reaches organization-defined percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity; and/or
      • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.1.c}} - locations to be warned when allocated audit record storage volume reaches organization-defined percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity;
    • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.2}} - the organization defines the time period within which the information system is to provide a warning to the organization-defined personnel, roles, and/or locations when allocated audit record storage volume reaches the organization-defined percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity;
    • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.3}} - the organization defines the percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity that, if reached, requires a warning to be provided; and
    • objective: {{au-5.1_obj.4}} - the information system provides a warning to the organization-defined personnel, roles, and/or locations within the organization-defined time period when allocated audit record storage volume reaches the organization-defined percentage of repository maximum audit record storage capacity.


  • Guidance

Parameters

securityControls.title: au-5.4 - Shutdown On Failure

    • objective: {{au-5.4_obj.2}} - the organization defines audit failures that, unless an alternate audit capability exists, are to trigger the information system to invoke a specific action; and
    • objective: {{au-5.4_obj.3}} - the information system invokes the selected specific action in the event of organization-defined audit failures, unless an alternate audit capability exists.

securityControls.title: au-6.1 - Process Integration
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{au-6.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs automated mechanisms to integrate audit review, analysis, and reporting processes to support organizational processes for investigation and response to suspicious activities.
  • ID: {{au-6.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.1}} - employs automated mechanisms to integrate:
      • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.1.a}} - audit review;
      • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.1.b}} - analysis;
      • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.1.c}} - reporting processes;
    • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.2}} - uses integrated audit review, analysis and reporting processes to support organizational processes for:
      • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.2.a}} - investigation of suspicious activities; and
      • objective: {{au-6.1_obj.2.b}} - response to suspicious activities.


  • Guidance
    • #au-12, related
    • #pm-7, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms integrating audit review, analysis, and reporting processes

securityControls.title: au-6.5 - Integration / Scanning and Monitoring Capabilities
securityControls.description:

  • ID: {{au-6.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.1}} - defines data/information to be collected from other sources;
    • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.2}} - selects sources of data/information to be analyzed and integrated with the analysis of audit records from one or more of the following:
      • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.2.a}} - vulnerability scanning information;
      • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.2.b}} - performance data;
      • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.2.c}} - information system monitoring information; and/or
      • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.2.d}} - organization-defined data/information collected from other sources; and
    • objective: {{au-6.5_obj.3}} - integrates the analysis of audit records with the analysis of selected data/information to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

    • #ir-4, related
    • #ra-5, related

securityControls.title: au-8 - Time Stamps
securityControls.description:

    • item: {{au-8_smt.a}} - Uses internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records; and
    • item: {{au-8_smt.b}} - Records time stamps for audit records that can be mapped to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and meets {{ au-8_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{au-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{au-8.a_obj}} - the information system uses internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records;

      • objective: {{au-8.b_obj.1}} - the information system records time stamps for audit records that can be mapped to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT);
      • objective: {{au-8.b_obj.2}} - the organization defines the granularity of time measurement to be met when recording time stamps for audit records; and

securityControls.title: au-8.1 - Synchronization with Authoritative Time Source
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{au-8.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{au-8.1_smt.a}} - Compares the internal information system clocks {{ au-8.1_prm_1 }} with {{ au-8.1_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{au-8.1_smt.b}} - Synchronizes the internal system clocks to the authoritative time source when the time difference is greater than {{ au-8.1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{au-8.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{au-8.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{au-8.1.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines the authoritative time source to which internal information system clocks are to be compared;
      • objective: {{au-8.1.a_obj.2}} - the organization defines the frequency to compare the internal information system clocks with the organization-defined authoritative time source; and
      • objective: {{au-8.1.a_obj.3}} - the information system compares the internal information system clocks with the organization-defined authoritative time source with organization-defined frequency; and
    • objective: {{au-8.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{au-8.1.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines the time period that, if exceeded by the time difference between the internal system clocks and the authoritative time source, will result in the internal system clocks being synchronized to the authoritative time source; and
      • objective: {{au-8.1.b_obj.2}} - the information system synchronizes the internal information system clocks to the authoritative time source when the time difference is greater than the organization-defined time period.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{au-8.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
{{au-8.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined authoritative time source
{{au-8.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined time period

securityControls.title: au-9 - Protection of Audit Information
securityControls.description:

securityControls.title: ca-1 - Security Assessment and Authorization Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ca-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ca-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.1}} - A security assessment and authorization policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy and associated security assessment and authorization controls; and
    • item: {{ca-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.b.1}} - Security assessment and authorization policy {{ ca-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.b.2}} - Security assessment and authorization procedures {{ ca-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ca-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a security assessment and authorization policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the security assessment and authorization policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the security assessment and authorization policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ca-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy and associated assessment and authorization controls;
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ca-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ca-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ca-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current security assessment and authorization policy;
        • objective: {{ca-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current security assessment and authorization policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ca-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ca-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current security assessment and authorization procedures; and
        • objective: {{ca-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current security assessment and authorization procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: ca-2 - Security Assessments
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.a}} - Develops a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including:
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.a.1}} - Security controls and control enhancements under assessment;
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.a.2}} - Assessment procedures to be used to determine security control effectiveness; and
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.a.3}} - Assessment environment, assessment team, and assessment roles and responsibilities;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.b}} - Assesses the security controls in the information system and its environment of operation {{ ca-2_prm_1 }} to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security requirements;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.c}} - Produces a security assessment report that documents the results of the assessment; and
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.d}} - Provides the results of the security control assessment to {{ ca-2_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{ca-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-2.a_obj}} - develops a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including:
      • objective: {{ca-2.a.1_obj}} - security controls and control enhancements under assessment;
      • objective: {{ca-2.a.2_obj}} - assessment procedures to be used to determine security control effectiveness;
      • objective: {{ca-2.a.3_obj}}
        • objective: {{ca-2.a.3_obj.1}} - assessment environment;
        • objective: {{ca-2.a.3_obj.2}} - assessment team;
        • objective: {{ca-2.a.3_obj.3}} - assessment roles and responsibilities;
    • objective: {{ca-2.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-2.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to assess the security controls in the information system and its environment of operation;
      • objective: {{ca-2.b_obj.2}} - assesses the security controls in the information system with the organization-defined frequency to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security requirements;
    • objective: {{ca-2.c_obj}} - produces a security assessment report that documents the results of the assessment;
    • objective: {{ca-2.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-2.d_obj.1}} - defines individuals or roles to whom the results of the security control assessment are to be provided; and
      • objective: {{ca-2.d_obj.2}} - provides the results of the security control assessment to organization-defined individuals or roles.

    • objective: {{ca-2.1_obj.1}} - defines the level of independence to be employed to conduct security control assessments; and

securityControls.title: ca-2.2 - Specialized Assessments
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-2.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization includes as part of security control assessments, {{ ca-2.2_prm_1 }}, {{ ca-2.2_prm_2 }}, {{ ca-2.2_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ca-2.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1}} - selects one or more of the following forms of specialized security assessment to be included as part of security control assessments:
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.a}} - in-depth monitoring;
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.b}} - vulnerability scanning;
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.c}} - malicious user testing;
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.d}} - insider threat assessment;
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.e}} - performance/load testing; and/or
      • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.1.f}} - other forms of organization-defined specialized security assessment;
    • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.2}} - defines the frequency for conducting the selected form(s) of specialized security assessment;
    • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.3}} - defines whether the specialized security assessment will be announced or unannounced; and
    • objective: {{ca-2.2_obj.4}} - conducts announced or unannounced organization-defined forms of specialized security assessments with the organization-defined frequency as part of security control assessments.


  • Guidance
    • #pe-3, related
    • #si-2, related

securityControls.title: ca-3 - System Interconnections

  • ID: {{ca-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-3.a_obj}} - authorizes connections from the information system to other information systems through the use of Interconnection Security Agreements;
    • objective: {{ca-3.b_obj}} - documents, for each interconnection:

securityControls.title: ca-4 - Security Certification
ca-5 - Plan of Action and Milestones
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ca-5_smt.a}} - Develops a plan of action and milestones for the information system to document the organization’s planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities in the system; and
    • item: {{ca-5_smt.b}} - Updates existing plan of action and milestones {{ ca-5_prm_1 }} based on the findings from security controls assessments, security impact analyses, and continuous monitoring activities.
  • ID: {{ca-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-5.a_obj}} - develops a plan of action and milestones for the information system to:
      • objective: {{ca-5.a_obj.1}} - document the organization’s planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls;
      • objective: {{ca-5.a_obj.2}} - reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities in the system;
    • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to update the existing plan of action and milestones;
      • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj.2}} - updates the existing plan of action and milestones with the organization-defined frequency based on the findings from:
        • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj.2.a}} - security controls assessments;
        • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj.2.b}} - security impact analyses; and
        • objective: {{ca-5.b_obj.2.c}} - continuous monitoring activities.

securityControls.title: ca-7 - Continuous Monitoring
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization develops a continuous monitoring strategy and implements a continuous monitoring program that includes:
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.a}} - Establishment of {{ ca-7_prm_1 }} to be monitored;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.b}} - Establishment of {{ ca-7_prm_2 }} for monitoring and {{ ca-7_prm_3 }} for assessments supporting such monitoring;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.c}} - Ongoing security control assessments in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.d}} - Ongoing security status monitoring of organization-defined metrics in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.e}} - Correlation and analysis of security-related information generated by assessments and monitoring;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.f}} - Response actions to address results of the analysis of security-related information; and
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.g}} - Reporting the security status of organization and the information system to {{ ca-7_prm_4 }} {{ ca-7_prm_5 }}.
  • ID: {{ca-7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ca-7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.a_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that defines metrics to be monitored;
      • objective: {{ca-7.a_obj.2}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes monitoring of organization-defined metrics;
      • objective: {{ca-7.a_obj.3}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes monitoring of organization-defined metrics in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.b_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that defines frequencies for monitoring;
      • objective: {{ca-7.b_obj.2}} - defines frequencies for assessments supporting monitoring;
      • objective: {{ca-7.b_obj.3}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes establishment of the organization-defined frequencies for monitoring and for assessments supporting monitoring;
      • objective: {{ca-7.b_obj.4}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes establishment of organization-defined frequencies for monitoring and for assessments supporting such monitoring in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.c_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes ongoing security control assessments;
      • objective: {{ca-7.c_obj.2}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes ongoing security control assessments in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.d_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes ongoing security status monitoring of organization-defined metrics;
      • objective: {{ca-7.d_obj.2}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes ongoing security status monitoring of organization-defined metrics in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.e_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes correlation and analysis of security-related information generated by assessments and monitoring;
      • objective: {{ca-7.e_obj.2}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes correlation and analysis of security-related information generated by assessments and monitoring in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.f_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes response actions to address results of the analysis of security-related information;
      • objective: {{ca-7.f_obj.2}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes response actions to address results of the analysis of security-related information in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy;
    • objective: {{ca-7.g_obj}}
      • objective: {{ca-7.g_obj.1}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that defines the personnel or roles to whom the security status of the organization and information system are to be reported;
      • objective: {{ca-7.g_obj.2}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that defines the frequency to report the security status of the organization and information system to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ca-7.g_obj.3}} - develops a continuous monitoring strategy that includes reporting the security status of the organization or information system to organizational-defined personnel or roles with the organization-defined frequency; and
      • objective: {{ca-7.g_obj.4}} - implements a continuous monitoring program that includes reporting the security status of the organization and information system to organization-defined personnel or roles with the organization-defined frequency in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy.

    • objective: {{ca-7.3_obj.3}} - the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process.

securityControls.title: ca-9 - Internal System Connections

securityControls.title: cm-1 - Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cm-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ cm-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{cm-1_smt.a.1}} - A configuration management policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{cm-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the configuration management policy and associated configuration management controls; and
    • item: {{cm-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{cm-1_smt.b.1}} - Configuration management policy {{ cm-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{cm-1_smt.b.2}} - Configuration management procedures {{ cm-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{cm-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a configuration management policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the configuration management policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the configuration management policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{cm-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the configuration management policy and associated configuration management controls;
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{cm-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{cm-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{cm-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current configuration management policy;
        • objective: {{cm-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current configuration management policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{cm-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{cm-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current configuration management procedures; and
        • objective: {{cm-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current configuration management procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cm-2.1 - Reviews and Updates
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-2.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization reviews and updates the baseline configuration of the information system:
    • item: {{cm-2.1_smt.a}} - {{ cm-2.1_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{cm-2.1_smt.b}} - When required due to {{ cm-2.1_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{cm-2.1_smt.c}} - As an integral part of information system component installations and upgrades.
  • ID: {{cm-2.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-2.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-2.1.a_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the baseline configuration of the information system;
      • objective: {{cm-2.1.a_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the baseline configuration of the information system with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{cm-2.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-2.1.b_obj.1}} - defines circumstances that require the baseline configuration of the information system to be reviewed and updated;
      • objective: {{cm-2.1.b_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the baseline configuration of the information system when required due to organization-defined circumstances; and
    • objective: {{cm-2.1.c_obj}} - reviews and updates the baseline configuration of the information system as an integral part of information system component installations and upgrades.

securityControls.title: cm-2.7 - Configure Systems, Components, or Devices for High-risk Areas
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-2.7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cm-2.7_smt.a}} - Issues {{ cm-2.7_prm_1 }} with {{ cm-2.7_prm_2 }} to individuals traveling to locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk; and
    • item: {{cm-2.7_smt.b}} - Applies {{ cm-2.7_prm_3 }} to the devices when the individuals return.
  • ID: {{cm-2.7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-2.7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-2.7.a_obj.1}} - defines information systems, system components, or devices to be issued to individuals traveling to locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk;
      • objective: {{cm-2.7.a_obj.2}} - defines configurations to be employed on organization-defined information systems, system components, or devices issued to individuals traveling to such locations;
      • objective: {{cm-2.7.a_obj.3}} - issues organization-defined information systems, system components, or devices with organization-defined configurations to individuals traveling to locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk;
    • objective: {{cm-2.7.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-2.7.b_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be applied to the devices when the individuals return; and

securityControls.title: cm-3 - Configuration Change Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.a}} - Determines the types of changes to the information system that are configuration-controlled;
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.b}} - Reviews proposed configuration-controlled changes to the information system and approves or disapproves such changes with explicit consideration for security impact analyses;
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.c}} - Documents configuration change decisions associated with the information system;
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.d}} - Implements approved configuration-controlled changes to the information system;
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.e}} - Retains records of configuration-controlled changes to the information system for {{ cm-3_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.f}} - Audits and reviews activities associated with configuration-controlled changes to the information system; and
    • item: {{cm-3_smt.g}} - Coordinates and provides oversight for configuration change control activities through {{ cm-3_prm_2 }} that convenes {{ cm-3_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{cm-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-3.a_obj}} - determines the type of changes to the information system that must be configuration-controlled;
    • objective: {{cm-3.b_obj}} - reviews proposed configuration-controlled changes to the information system and approves or disapproves such changes with explicit consideration for security impact analyses;
    • objective: {{cm-3.c_obj}} - documents configuration change decisions associated with the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.d_obj}} - implements approved configuration-controlled changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-3.e_obj.1}} - defines a time period to retain records of configuration-controlled changes to the information system;
      • objective: {{cm-3.e_obj.2}} - retains records of configuration-controlled changes to the information system for the organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{cm-3.f_obj}} - audits and reviews activities associated with configuration-controlled changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.g_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-3.g_obj.1}} - defines a configuration change control element (e.g., committee, board) responsible for coordinating and providing oversight for configuration change control activities;
      • objective: {{cm-3.g_obj.2}} - defines the frequency with which the configuration change control element must convene; and/or
      • objective: {{cm-3.g_obj.3}} - defines configuration change conditions that prompt the configuration change control element to convene; and
      • objective: {{cm-3.g_obj.4}} - coordinates and provides oversight for configuration change control activities through organization-defined configuration change control element that convenes at organization-defined frequency and/or for any organization-defined configuration change conditions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cm-3.1 - Automated Document / Notification / Prohibition of Changes
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-3.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs automated mechanisms to:
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.a}} - Document proposed changes to the information system;
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.b}} - Notify {{ cm-3.1_prm_1 }} of proposed changes to the information system and request change approval;
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.c}} - Highlight proposed changes to the information system that have not been approved or disapproved by {{ cm-3.1_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.d}} - Prohibit changes to the information system until designated approvals are received;
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.e}} - Document all changes to the information system; and
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.f}} - Notify {{ cm-3.1_prm_3 }} when approved changes to the information system are completed.
  • ID: {{cm-3.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.a_obj}} - employs automated mechanisms to document proposed changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.b_obj.1}} - defines approval authorities to be notified of proposed changes to the information system and request change approval;
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.b_obj.2}} - employs automated mechanisms to notify organization-defined approval authorities of proposed changes to the information system and request change approval;
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.c_obj.1}} - defines the time period within which proposed changes to the information system that have not been approved or disapproved must be highlighted;
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.c_obj.2}} - employs automated mechanisms to highlight proposed changes to the information system that have not been approved or disapproved by organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.d_obj}} - employs automated mechanisms to prohibit changes to the information system until designated approvals are received;
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.e_obj}} - employs automated mechanisms to document all changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.1.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.f_obj.1}} - defines personnel to be notified when approved changes to the information system are completed; and
      • objective: {{cm-3.1.f_obj.2}} - employs automated mechanisms to notify organization-defined personnel when approved changes to the information system are completed.
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{cm-3.1_prm_1}}: organized-defined approval authorities
{{cm-3.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined time period
{{cm-3.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined personnel
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for configuration change control automated mechanisms implementing configuration change control activities

securityControls.title: cm-3.2 - Test / Validate / Document Changes
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization tests, validates, and documents changes to the information system before implementing the changes on the operational system.
  • ID: {{cm-3.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization, before implementing changes on the operational system:
    • objective: {{cm-3.2_obj.1}} - tests changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-3.2_obj.2}} - validates changes to the information system; and
    • objective: {{cm-3.2_obj.3}} - documents changes to the information system.


  • Guidance
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for configuration change control automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing testing, validating, and documenting information system changes

securityControls.title: cm-3.3 - Automated Change Implementation

• ID: {{cm-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs automated mechanisms to implement changes to the current information system baseline and deploys the updated baseline across the installed base.
  • ID: {{cm-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-3.3_obj.1}} - employs automated mechanisms to implement changes to the current information system baseline; and
    • objective: {{cm-3.3_obj.2}} - deploys the updated baseline across the installed base.
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for configuration change control automated mechanisms implementing changes to current information system baseline

securityControls.title: cm-3.5 - Automated Security Response
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-3.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system implements {{ cm-3.5_prm_1 }} automatically if baseline configurations are changed in an unauthorized manner.
  • ID: {{cm-3.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{cm-3.5_obj.1}} - the organization defines security responses to be implemented automatically if baseline configurations are changed in an unauthorized manner; and
    • objective: {{cm-3.5_obj.2}} - the information system implements organization-defined security responses automatically if baseline configurations are changed in an unauthorized manner.

securityControls.title: cm-3.6 - Cryptography Management

securityControls.title: cm-4 - Security Impact Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization analyzes changes to the information system to determine potential security impacts prior to change implementation.
  • ID: {{cm-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization analyzes changes to the information system to determine potential security impacts prior to change implementation.

securityControls.title: cm-4.1 - Separate Test Environments
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-4.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization analyzes changes to the information system in a separate test environment before implementation in an operational environment, looking for security impacts due to flaws, weaknesses, incompatibility, or intentional malice.
  • ID: {{cm-4.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.1}} - analyzes changes to the information system in a separate test environment before implementation in an operational environment;
    • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.2}} - when analyzing changes to the information system in a separate test environment, looks for security impacts due to:
      • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.2.a}} - flaws;
      • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.2.b}} - weaknesses;
      • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.2.c}} - incompatibility; and
      • objective: {{cm-4.1_obj.2.d}} - intentional malice.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-11, related
    • #sc-3, related
    • #sc-7, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for security impact analysis automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing security impact analysis of changes

securityControls.title: cm-4.2 - Verification of Security Functions
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-4.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization, after the information system is changed, checks the security functions to verify that the functions are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with regard to meeting the security requirements for the system.
  • ID: {{cm-4.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization, after the information system is changed, checks the security functions to verify that the functions are:
    • objective: {{cm-4.2_obj.1}} - implemented correctly;
    • objective: {{cm-4.2_obj.2}} - operating as intended; and
    • objective: {{cm-4.2_obj.3}} - producing the desired outcome with regard to meeting the security requirements for the system.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-11, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for security impact analysis automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing verification of security functions

securityControls.title: cm-5 - Access Restrictions for Change
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization defines, documents, approves, and enforces physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system.
  • ID: {{cm-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.1}} - defines physical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.2}} - documents physical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.3}} - approves physical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.4}} - enforces physical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.5}} - defines logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.6}} - documents logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.7}} - approves logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system; and
    • objective: {{cm-5_obj.8}} - enforces logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system.


  • Guidance

    • #ac-6, related
    • #pe-3, related

securityControls.title: cm-5.2 - Review System Changes
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-5.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization reviews information system changes {{ cm-5.2_prm_1 }} and {{ cm-5.2_prm_2 }} to determine whether unauthorized changes have occurred.

    • objective: {{cm-5.2_obj.3}} - reviews information system changes with the organization-defined frequency; and

securityControls.title: cm-5.3 - Signed Components
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-5.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system prevents the installation of {{ cm-5.3_prm_1 }} without verification that the component has been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.
  • ID: {{cm-5.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{cm-5.3_obj.1}} - the organization defines software and firmware components that the information system will prevent from being installed without verification that such components have been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization; and
    • objective: {{cm-5.3_obj.2}} - the information system prevents the installation of organization-defined software and firmware components without verification that such components have been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.
