securityControls.title: cm-5.7 - Automatic Implementation of Security Safeguards
cm-6 - Configuration Settings
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-6_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cm-6_smt.a}} - Establishes and documents configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system using {{ cm-6_prm_1 }} that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements;
    • item: {{cm-6_smt.b}} - Implements the configuration settings;
    • item: {{cm-6_smt.c}} - Identifies, documents, and approves any deviations from established configuration settings for {{ cm-6_prm_2 }} based on {{ cm-6_prm_3 }}; and
    • item: {{cm-6_smt.d}} - Monitors and controls changes to the configuration settings in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
  • ID: {{cm-6_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-6.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-6.a_obj.1}} - defines security configuration checklists to be used to establish and document configuration settings for the information technology products employed;
      • objective: {{cm-6.a_obj.2}} - ensures the defined security configuration checklists reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements;
      • objective: {{cm-6.a_obj.3}} - establishes and documents configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system using organization-defined security configuration checklists;
    • objective: {{cm-6.b_obj}} - implements the configuration settings established/documented in CM-6(a);;
    • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.1}} - defines information system components for which any deviations from established configuration settings must be:
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.1.a}} - identified;
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.1.b}} - documented;
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.1.c}} - approved;
      • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.2}} - defines operational requirements to support:
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.2.a}} - the identification of any deviations from established configuration settings;
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.2.b}} - the documentation of any deviations from established configuration settings;
        • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.2.c}} - the approval of any deviations from established configuration settings;
      • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.3}} - identifies any deviations from established configuration settings for organization-defined information system components based on organizational-defined operational requirements;
      • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.4}} - documents any deviations from established configuration settings for organization-defined information system components based on organizational-defined operational requirements;
      • objective: {{cm-6.c_obj.5}} - approves any deviations from established configuration settings for organization-defined information system components based on organizational-defined operational requirements;
    • objective: {{cm-6.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-6.d_obj.1}} - monitors changes to the configuration settings in accordance with organizational policies and procedures; and
      • objective: {{cm-6.d_obj.2}} - controls changes to the configuration settings in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.


  • Guidance
    • #ac-19, related
    • #cm-2, related
    • #cm-3, related
    • #cm-7, related
    • #si-4, related

securityControls.title: cm-7.1 - Periodic Review
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-7.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:

    • item: {{cm-7.1_smt.b}} - Disables {{ cm-7.1_prm_2 }}.

      • objective: {{cm-7.1.a_obj.2}} - reviews the information system with the organization-defined frequency to identify unnecessary and/or nonsecure:
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.a_obj.2.a}} - functions;
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.a_obj.2.b}} - ports;
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.a_obj.2.c}} - protocols; and/or
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.a_obj.2.d}} - services;
    • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.1}} - defines, within the information system, unnecessary and/or nonsecure:
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.1.a}} - functions;
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.1.b}} - ports;
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.1.c}} - protocols; and/or
        • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.1.d}} - services;
      • objective: {{cm-7.1.b_obj.2}} - disables organization-defined unnecessary and/or nonsecure:

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:

      • item: {{cm-8_smt.a.1}} - Accurately reflects the current information system;
      • item: {{cm-8_smt.a.2}} - Includes all components within the authorization boundary of the information system;
      • item: {{cm-8_smt.a.3}} - Is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting; and
      • item: {{cm-8_smt.a.4}} - Includes {{ cm-8_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{cm-8_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the information system component inventory {{ cm-8_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{cm-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

        • objective: {{cm-8.a.4_obj.2}} - develops and documents an inventory of information system components that includes organization-defined information deemed necessary to achieve effective information system component accountability;
    • objective: {{cm-8.b_obj}}

securityControls.title: cm-8.3 - Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cm-8.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cm-8.3_smt.a}} - Employs automated mechanisms {{ cm-8.3_prm_1 }} to detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the information system; and
    • item: {{cm-8.3_smt.b}} - Takes the following actions when unauthorized components are detected: {{ cm-8.3_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{cm-8.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to employ automated mechanisms to detect the presence of unauthorized:
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.1.a}} - hardware components within the information system;
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.1.b}} - software components within the information system;
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.1.c}} - firmware components within the information system;
      • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.2}} - employs automated mechanisms with the organization-defined frequency to detect the presence of unauthorized:
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.2.a}} - hardware components within the information system;
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.2.b}} - software components within the information system;
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.a_obj.2.c}} - firmware components within the information system;
    • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to be notified when unauthorized components are detected;
      • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj.2}} - takes one or more of the following actions when unauthorized components are detected:
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj.2.a}} - disables network access by such components;
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj.2.b}} - isolates the components; and/or
        • objective: {{cm-8.3.b_obj.2.c}} - notifies organization-defined personnel or roles.

    • item: {{cm-11_smt.c}} - Monitors policy compliance at {{ cm-11_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{cm-11_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cm-11.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-11.a_obj.1}} - defines policies to govern the installation of software by users;
      • objective: {{cm-11.a_obj.2}} - establishes organization-defined policies governing the installation of software by users;
    • objective: {{cm-11.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-11.b_obj.1}} - defines methods to enforce software installation policies;
      • objective: {{cm-11.b_obj.2}} - enforces software installation policies through organization-defined methods;
    • objective: {{cm-11.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cm-11.c_obj.1}} - defines frequency to monitor policy compliance; and
      • objective: {{cm-11.c_obj.2}} - monitors policy compliance at organization-defined frequency.

securityControls.title: cp-1 - Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cp-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ cp-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{cp-1_smt.a.1}} - A contingency planning policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{cp-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and associated contingency planning controls; and
    • item: {{cp-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{cp-1_smt.b.1}} - Contingency planning policy {{ cp-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{cp-1_smt.b.2}} - Contingency planning procedures {{ cp-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{cp-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{cp-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1}} - the organization develops and documents a contingency planning policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.2}} - the organization defines personnel or roles to whom the contingency planning policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.1_obj.3}} - the organization disseminates the contingency planning policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{cp-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.2_obj.1}} - the organization develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and associated contingency planning controls;
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.2_obj.2}} - the organization defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{cp-1.a.2_obj.3}} - the organization disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{cp-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-1.b.1_obj.1}} - the organization defines the frequency to review and update the current contingency planning policy;
        • objective: {{cp-1.b.1_obj.2}} - the organization reviews and updates the current contingency planning with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{cp-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-1.b.2_obj.1}} - the organization defines the frequency to review and update the current contingency planning procedures; and
        • objective: {{cp-1.b.2_obj.2}} - the organization reviews and updates the current contingency planning procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: cp-2 - Contingency Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.a}} - Develops a contingency plan for the information system that:
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.1}} - Identifies essential missions and business functions and associated contingency requirements;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.2}} - Provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.3}} - Addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned individuals with contact information;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.4}} - Addresses maintaining essential missions and business functions despite an information system disruption, compromise, or failure;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.5}} - Addresses eventual, full information system restoration without deterioration of the security safeguards originally planned and implemented; and
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.6}} - Is reviewed and approved by {{ cp-2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.b}} - Distributes copies of the contingency plan to {{ cp-2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.c}} - Coordinates contingency planning activities with incident handling activities;
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.d}} - Reviews the contingency plan for the information system {{ cp-2_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.e}} - Updates the contingency plan to address changes to the organization, information system, or environment of operation and problems encountered during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing;
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.f}} - Communicates contingency plan changes to {{ cp-2_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.g}} - Protects the contingency plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.
  • ID: {{cp-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cp-2.a_obj}} - develops and documents a contingency plan for the information system that:
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.1_obj}} - identifies essential missions and business functions and associated contingency requirements;
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.2_obj.1}} - provides recovery objectives;
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.2_obj.2}} - provides restoration priorities;
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.2_obj.3}} - provides metrics;
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.3_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.3_obj.1}} - addresses contingency roles;
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.3_obj.2}} - addresses contingency responsibilities;
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.3_obj.3}} - addresses assigned individuals with contact information;
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.4_obj}} - addresses maintaining essential missions and business functions despite an information system disruption, compromise, or failure;
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.5_obj}} - addresses eventual, full information system restoration without deterioration of the security safeguards originally planned and implemented;
      • objective: {{cp-2.a.6_obj}}
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.6_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to review and approve the contingency plan for the information system;
        • objective: {{cp-2.a.6_obj.2}} - is reviewed and approved by organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{cp-2.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-2.b_obj.1}} - defines key contingency personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements to whom copies of the contingency plan are to be distributed;
      • objective: {{cp-2.b_obj.2}} - distributes copies of the contingency plan to organization-defined key contingency personnel and organizational elements;
    • objective: {{cp-2.c_obj}} - coordinates contingency planning activities with incident handling activities;
    • objective: {{cp-2.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-2.d_obj.1}} - defines a frequency to review the contingency plan for the information system;
      • objective: {{cp-2.d_obj.2}} - reviews the contingency plan with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{cp-2.e_obj}} - updates the contingency plan to address:
      • objective: {{cp-2.e_obj.1}} - changes to the organization, information system, or environment of operation;
      • objective: {{cp-2.e_obj.2}} - problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, and testing;
    • objective: {{cp-2.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-2.f_obj.1}} - defines key contingency personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements to whom contingency plan changes are to be communicated;
      • objective: {{cp-2.f_obj.2}} - communicates contingency plan changes to organization-defined key contingency personnel and organizational elements; and
    • objective: {{cp-2.g_obj}} - protects the contingency plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

securityControls.title: cp-3 - Contingency Training
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization provides contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:
    • item: {{cp-3_smt.a}} - Within {{ cp-3_prm_1 }} of assuming a contingency role or responsibility;
    • item: {{cp-3_smt.b}} - When required by information system changes; and
    • item: {{cp-3_smt.c}} - {{ cp-3_prm_2 }} thereafter.
  • ID: {{cp-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cp-3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-3.a_obj.1}} - defines a time period within which contingency training is to be provided to information system users assuming a contingency role or responsibility;
      • objective: {{cp-3.a_obj.2}} - provides contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities within the organization-defined time period of assuming a contingency role or responsibility;
    • objective: {{cp-3.b_obj}} - provides contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes;
    • objective: {{cp-3.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-3.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency for contingency training thereafter; and
      • objective: {{cp-3.c_obj.2}} - provides contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities with the organization-defined frequency thereafter.

securityControls.description:

    • item: {{cp-4_smt.a}} - Tests the contingency plan for the information system {{ cp-4_prm_1 }} using {{ cp-4_prm_2 }} to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the organizational readiness to execute the plan;

securityControls.title: cp-4.4 - Full Recovery / Reconstitution

securityControls.title: cp-7 - Alternate Processing Site
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cp-7_smt.a}} - Establishes an alternate processing site including necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of {{ cp-7_prm_1 }} for essential missions/business functions within {{ cp-7_prm_2 }} when the primary processing capabilities are unavailable;
    • item: {{cp-7_smt.b}} - Ensures that equipment and supplies required to transfer and resume operations are available at the alternate processing site or contracts are in place to support delivery to the site within the organization-defined time period for transfer/resumption; and
    • item: {{cp-7_smt.c}} - Ensures that the alternate processing site provides information security safeguards equivalent to those of the primary site.
  • ID: {{cp-7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cp-7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-7.a_obj.1}} - defines information system operations requiring an alternate processing site to be established to permit the transfer and resumption of such operations;
      • objective: {{cp-7.a_obj.2}} - defines the time period consistent with recovery time objectives and recovery point objectives (as specified in the information system contingency plan) for transfer/resumption of organization-defined information system operations for essential missions/business functions;
      • objective: {{cp-7.a_obj.3}} - establishes an alternate processing site including necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of organization-defined information system operations for essential missions/business functions, within the organization-defined time period, when the primary processing capabilities are unavailable;
    • objective: {{cp-7.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-7.b_obj.1}} - ensures that equipment and supplies required to transfer and resume operations are available at the alternate processing site; or
      • objective: {{cp-7.b_obj.2}} - ensures that contracts are in place to support delivery to the site within the organization-defined time period for transfer/resumption; and
    • objective: {{cp-7.c_obj}} - ensures that the alternate processing site provides information security safeguards equivalent to those of the primary site.

securityControls.title: cp-8 - Telecommunications Services
securityControls.description:

securityControls.title: cp-8.4 - Provider Contingency Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-8.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cp-8.4_smt.a}} - Requires primary and alternate telecommunications service providers to have contingency plans;
    • item: {{cp-8.4_smt.b}} - Reviews provider contingency plans to ensure that the plans meet organizational contingency requirements; and
    • item: {{cp-8.4_smt.c}} - Obtains evidence of contingency testing/training by providers {{ cp-8.4_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{cp-8.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cp-8.4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-8.4.a_obj.1}} - requires primary telecommunications service provider to have contingency plans;
      • objective: {{cp-8.4.a_obj.2}} - requires alternate telecommunications service provider(s) to have contingency plans;
    • objective: {{cp-8.4.b_obj}} - reviews provider contingency plans to ensure that the plans meet organizational contingency requirements;
    • objective: {{cp-8.4.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-8.4.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to obtain evidence of contingency testing/training by providers; and
      • objective: {{cp-8.4.c_obj.2}} - obtains evidence of contingency testing/training by providers with the organization-defined frequency.

securityControls.title: cp-9 - Information System Backup
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{cp-9_smt.a}} - Conducts backups of user-level information contained in the information system {{ cp-9_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{cp-9_smt.b}} - Conducts backups of system-level information contained in the information system {{ cp-9_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{cp-9_smt.c}} - Conducts backups of information system documentation including security-related documentation {{ cp-9_prm_3 }}; and
    • item: {{cp-9_smt.d}} - Protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information at storage locations.
  • ID: {{cp-9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{cp-9.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-9.a_obj.1}} - defines a frequency, consistent with recovery time objectives and recovery point objectives as specified in the information system contingency plan, to conduct backups of user-level information contained in the information system;
      • objective: {{cp-9.a_obj.2}} - conducts backups of user-level information contained in the information system with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{cp-9.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-9.b_obj.1}} - defines a frequency, consistent with recovery time objectives and recovery point objectives as specified in the information system contingency plan, to conduct backups of system-level information contained in the information system;
      • objective: {{cp-9.b_obj.2}} - conducts backups of system-level information contained in the information system with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{cp-9.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{cp-9.c_obj.1}} - defines a frequency, consistent with recovery time objectives and recovery point objectives as specified in the information system contingency plan, to conduct backups of information system documentation including security-related documentation;
      • objective: {{cp-9.c_obj.2}} - conducts backups of information system documentation, including security-related documentation, with the organization-defined frequency; and
    • objective: {{cp-9.d_obj}} - protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information at storage locations.

securityControls.title: ia-1 - Identification and Authentication Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ia-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ia-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.1}} - An identification and authentication policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the identification and authentication policy and associated identification and authentication controls; and
    • item: {{ia-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.b.1}} - Identification and authentication policy {{ ia-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.b.2}} - Identification and authentication procedures {{ ia-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ia-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ia-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents an identification and authentication policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the identification and authentication policy is to be disseminated; and
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the identification and authentication policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ia-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the identification and authentication policy and associated identification and authentication controls;
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ia-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ia-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ia-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current identification and authentication policy;
        • objective: {{ia-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current identification and authentication policy with the organization-defined frequency; and
      • objective: {{ia-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ia-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current identification and authentication procedures; and
        • objective: {{ia-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current identification and authentication procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

ia-3.3 - Dynamic Address Allocation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ia-3.3_smt.a}} - Standardizes dynamic address allocation lease information and the lease duration assigned to devices in accordance with {{ ia-3.3_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ia-3.3_smt.b}} - Audits lease information when assigned to a device.
  • ID: {{ia-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ia-3.3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-3.3.a_obj.1}} - defines lease information to be employed to standardize dynamic address allocation for devices;
      • objective: {{ia-3.3.a_obj.2}} - defines lease duration to be employed to standardize dynamic address allocation for devices;

    • objective: {{ia-3.3.b_obj}} - audits lease information when assigned to a device.

securityControls.title: ia-4 - Identifier Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization manages information system identifiers by:
    • item: {{ia-4_smt.a}} - Receiving authorization from {{ ia-4_prm_1 }} to assign an individual, group, role, or device identifier;
    • item: {{ia-4_smt.b}} - Selecting an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, or device;
    • item: {{ia-4_smt.c}} - Assigning the identifier to the intended individual, group, role, or device;
    • item: {{ia-4_smt.d}} - Preventing reuse of identifiers for {{ ia-4_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{ia-4_smt.e}} - Disabling the identifier after {{ ia-4_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ia-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization manages information system identifiers by:
    • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.1}} - defining personnel or roles from whom authorization must be received to assign:
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.1.a}} - an individual identifier;
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.1.b}} - a group identifier;
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.1.c}} - a role identifier; and/or
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.1.d}} - a device identifier;
      • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.2}} - receiving authorization from organization-defined personnel or roles to assign:
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.2.a}} - an individual identifier;
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.2.b}} - a group identifier;
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.2.c}} - a role identifier; and/or
        • objective: {{ia-4.a_obj.2.d}} - a device identifier;
    • objective: {{ia-4.b_obj}} - selecting an identifier that identifies:
      • objective: {{ia-4.b_obj.1}} - an individual;
      • objective: {{ia-4.b_obj.2}} - a group;
      • objective: {{ia-4.b_obj.3}} - a role; and/or
      • objective: {{ia-4.b_obj.4}} - a device;
    • objective: {{ia-4.c_obj}} - assigning the identifier to the intended:
      • objective: {{ia-4.c_obj.1}} - individual;
      • objective: {{ia-4.c_obj.2}} - group;
      • objective: {{ia-4.c_obj.3}} - role; and/or
      • objective: {{ia-4.c_obj.4}} - device;
    • objective: {{ia-4.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-4.d_obj.1}} - defining a time period for preventing reuse of identifiers;
      • objective: {{ia-4.d_obj.2}} - preventing reuse of identifiers for the organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{ia-4.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-4.e_obj.1}} - defining a time period of inactivity to disable the identifier; and
      • objective: {{ia-4.e_obj.2}} - disabling the identifier after the organization-defined time period of inactivity.

securityControls.title: ia-5 - Authenticator Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization manages information system authenticators by:
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.a}} - Verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of the individual, group, role, or device receiving the authenticator;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.b}} - Establishing initial authenticator content for authenticators defined by the organization;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.c}} - Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.d}} - Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost/compromised or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.e}} - Changing default content of authenticators prior to information system installation;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.f}} - Establishing minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions and reuse conditions for authenticators;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.g}} - Changing/refreshing authenticators {{ ia-5_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.h}} - Protecting authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure and modification;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.i}} - Requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement, specific security safeguards to protect authenticators; and
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.j}} - Changing authenticators for group/role accounts when membership to those accounts changes.
  • ID: {{ia-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization manages information system authenticators by:
    • objective: {{ia-5.a_obj}} - verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of:
      • objective: {{ia-5.a_obj.1}} - the individual receiving the authenticator;
      • objective: {{ia-5.a_obj.2}} - the group receiving the authenticator;
      • objective: {{ia-5.a_obj.3}} - the role receiving the authenticator; and/or
      • objective: {{ia-5.a_obj.4}} - the device receiving the authenticator;
    • objective: {{ia-5.b_obj}} - establishing initial authenticator content for authenticators defined by the organization;
    • objective: {{ia-5.c_obj}} - ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use;
    • objective: {{ia-5.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.d_obj.1}} - establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution;
      • objective: {{ia-5.d_obj.2}} - establishing and implementing administrative procedures for lost/compromised or damaged authenticators;
      • objective: {{ia-5.d_obj.3}} - establishing and implementing administrative procedures for revoking authenticators;
    • objective: {{ia-5.e_obj}} - changing default content of authenticators prior to information system installation;
    • objective: {{ia-5.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.f_obj.1}} - establishing minimum lifetime restrictions for authenticators;
      • objective: {{ia-5.f_obj.2}} - establishing maximum lifetime restrictions for authenticators;
      • objective: {{ia-5.f_obj.3}} - establishing reuse conditions for authenticators;
    • objective: {{ia-5.g_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.g_obj.1}} - defining a time period (by authenticator type) for changing/refreshing authenticators;
      • objective: {{ia-5.g_obj.2}} - changing/refreshing authenticators with the organization-defined time period by authenticator type;
    • objective: {{ia-5.h_obj}} - protecting authenticator content from unauthorized:
      • objective: {{ia-5.h_obj.1}} - disclosure;
      • objective: {{ia-5.h_obj.2}} - modification;
    • objective: {{ia-5.i_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.i_obj.1}} - requiring individuals to take specific security safeguards to protect authenticators;
      • objective: {{ia-5.i_obj.2}} - having devices implement specific security safeguards to protect authenticators; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.j_obj}} - changing authenticators for group/role accounts when membership to those accounts changes.

securityControls.title: ia-5.1 - Password-based Authentication
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system, for password-based authentication:
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.a}} - Enforces minimum password complexity of {{ ia-5.1_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.b}} - Enforces at least the following number of changed characters when new passwords are created: {{ ia-5.1_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.c}} - Stores and transmits only cryptographically-protected passwords;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.d}} - Enforces password minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions of {{ ia-5.1_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.e}} - Prohibits password reuse for {{ ia-5.1_prm_4 }} generations; and
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.f}} - Allows the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.
  • ID: {{ia-5.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if, for password-based authentication:
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines requirements for case sensitivity;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.2}} - the organization defines requirements for number of characters;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.3}} - the organization defines requirements for the mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers and special characters;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.4}} - the organization defines minimum requirements for each type of character;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.5}} - the information system enforces minimum password complexity of organization-defined requirements for case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines a minimum number of changed characters to be enforced when new passwords are created;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj.2}} - the information system enforces at least the organization-defined minimum number of characters that must be changed when new passwords are created;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.c_obj}} - the information system stores and transmits only encrypted representations of passwords;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.1}} - the organization defines numbers for password minimum lifetime restrictions to be enforced for passwords;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.2}} - the organization defines numbers for password maximum lifetime restrictions to be enforced for passwords;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.3}} - the information system enforces password minimum lifetime restrictions of organization-defined numbers for lifetime minimum;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.4}} - the information system enforces password maximum lifetime restrictions of organization-defined numbers for lifetime maximum;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj.1}} - the organization defines the number of password generations to be prohibited from password reuse;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj.2}} - the information system prohibits password reuse for the organization-defined number of generations; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.f_obj}} - the information system allows the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.


  • Guidance
    • #ia-6, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ia-5.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined requirements for case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type
{{ia-5.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined number
{{ia-5.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined numbers for lifetime minimum, lifetime maximum
{{ia-5.1_prm_4}}: organization-defined number
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing password-based authenticator management capability

securityControls.title: ia-5.2 - Pki-based Authentication
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system, for PKI-based authentication:
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.a}} - Validates certifications by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information;
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.b}} - Enforces authorized access to the corresponding private key;
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.c}} - Maps the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group; and
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.d}} - Implements a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation in case of inability to access revocation information via the network.
  • ID: {{ia-5.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the information system, for PKI-based authentication:
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.1}} - validates certifications by constructing a certification path to an accepted trust anchor;
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.2}} - validates certifications by verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor;
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.3}} - includes checking certificate status information when constructing and verifying the certification path;
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.b_obj}} - enforces authorized access to the corresponding private key;
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.c_obj}} - maps the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.d_obj}} - implements a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation in case of inability to access revocation information via the network.


  • Guidance
    • #ia-6, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing PKI-based, authenticator management capability

securityControls.title: ia-5.3 - In-person or Trusted Third-party Registration
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires that the registration process to receive {{ ia-5.3_prm_1 }} be conducted {{ ia-5.3_prm_2 }} before {{ ia-5.3_prm_3 }} with authorization by {{ ia-5.3_prm_4 }}.
  • ID: {{ia-5.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.1}} - defines types of and/or specific authenticators to be received in person or by a trusted third party;
    • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.2}} - defines the registration authority with oversight of the registration process for receipt of organization-defined types of and/or specific authenticators;
    • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.3}} - defines personnel or roles responsible for authorizing organization-defined registration authority;
    • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.4}} - defines if the registration process is to be conducted:
      • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.4.a}} - in person; or
      • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.4.b}} - by a trusted third party; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.3_obj.5}} - requires that the registration process to receive organization-defined types of and/or specific authenticators be conducted in person or by a trusted third party before organization-defined registration authority with authorization by organization-defined personnel or roles.
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ia-5.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined types of and/or specific authenticators
ia-5.3_prm_2, in person, by a trusted third party,
{{ia-5.3_prm_3}}: organization-defined registration authority
{{ia-5.3_prm_4}}: organization-defined personnel or roles

securityControls.title: ia-5.7 - No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that unencrypted static authenticators are not embedded in applications or access scripts or stored on function keys.

securityControls.title: ia-5.8 - Multiple Information System Accounts
securityControls.description:

    • objective: {{ia-5.14_obj.4}} - applications.

securityControls.title: ir-1 - Incident Response Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ir-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ir-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.1}} - An incident response policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the incident response policy and associated incident response controls; and
    • item: {{ir-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.b.1}} - Incident response policy {{ ir-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.b.2}} - Incident response procedures {{ ir-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ir-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ir-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents an incident response policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the incident response policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the incident response policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ir-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the incident response policy and associated incident response controls;
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ir-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ir-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ir-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current incident response policy;
        • objective: {{ir-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current incident response policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ir-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ir-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current incident response procedures; and
        • objective: {{ir-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current incident response procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: ir-2 - Incident Response Training
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization provides incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:
    • item: {{ir-2_smt.a}} - Within {{ ir-2_prm_1 }} of assuming an incident response role or responsibility;
    • item: {{ir-2_smt.b}} - When required by information system changes; and
    • item: {{ir-2_smt.c}} - {{ ir-2_prm_2 }} thereafter.
  • ID: {{ir-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ir-2.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-2.a_obj.1}} - defines a time period within which incident response training is to be provided to information system users assuming an incident response role or responsibility;
      • objective: {{ir-2.a_obj.2}} - provides incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities within the organization-defined time period of assuming an incident response role or responsibility;
    • objective: {{ir-2.b_obj}} - provides incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes;
    • objective: {{ir-2.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-2.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to provide refresher incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles or responsibilities; and
      • objective: {{ir-2.c_obj.2}} - after the initial incident response training, provides refresher incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities in accordance with the organization-defined frequency to provide refresher training.


  • Guidance
    • #at-3, related
    • #cp-3, related
    • #ir-8, related

securityControls.title: ir-4 - Incident Handling
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.a}} - Implements an incident handling capability for security incidents that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery;
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.b}} - Coordinates incident handling activities with contingency planning activities; and
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.c}} - Incorporates lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing, and implements the resulting changes accordingly.
  • ID: {{ir-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj}} - implements an incident handling capability for security incidents that includes:
      • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj.1}} - preparation;
      • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj.2}} - detection and analysis;
      • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj.3}} - containment;
      • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj.4}} - eradication;
      • objective: {{ir-4.a_obj.5}} - recovery;
    • objective: {{ir-4.b_obj}} - coordinates incident handling activities with contingency planning activities;
    • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.1}} - incorporates lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into:
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.1.a}} - incident response procedures;
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.1.b}} - training;
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.1.c}} - testing/exercises;
      • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.2}} - implements the resulting changes accordingly to:
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.2.a}} - incident response procedures;
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.2.b}} - training; and
        • objective: {{ir-4.c_obj.2.c}} - testing/exercises.

securityControls.title: ir-8 - Incident Response Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.a}} - Develops an incident response plan that:
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.1}} - Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.2}} - Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.3}} - Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.4}} - Meets the unique requirements of the organization, which relate to mission, size, structure, and functions;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.5}} - Defines reportable incidents;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.6}} - Provides metrics for measuring the incident response capability within the organization;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.7}} - Defines the resources and management support needed to effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability; and
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.8}} - Is reviewed and approved by {{ ir-8_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.b}} - Distributes copies of the incident response plan to {{ ir-8_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.c}} - Reviews the incident response plan {{ ir-8_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.d}} - Updates the incident response plan to address system/organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing;
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.e}} - Communicates incident response plan changes to {{ ir-8_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.f}} - Protects the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.
  • ID: {{ir-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ir-8.a_obj}} - develops an incident response plan that:
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.1_obj}} - provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.2_obj}} - describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.3_obj}} - provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj}} - meets the unique requirements of the organization, which relate to:
        • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj.1}} - mission;
        • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj.2}} - size;
        • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj.3}} - structure;
        • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj.4}} - functions;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.5_obj}} - defines reportable incidents;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.6_obj}} - provides metrics for measuring the incident response capability within the organization;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.7_obj}} - defines the resources and management support needed to effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability;
      • objective: {{ir-8.a.8_obj}}

        • objective: {{ir-8.a.8_obj.2}} - is reviewed and approved by organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ir-8.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-8.b_obj.1}}

        • objective: {{ir-8.b_obj.1.b}} - defines organizational elements to whom copies of the incident response plan are to be distributed;
      • objective: {{ir-8.b_obj.2}} - distributes copies of the incident response plan to organization-defined incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements;
    • objective: {{ir-8.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-8.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review the incident response plan;
      • objective: {{ir-8.c_obj.2}} - reviews the incident response plan with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{ir-8.d_obj}} - updates the incident response plan to address system/organizational changes or problems encountered during plan:

    • objective: {{ir-8.e_obj}}

securityControls.title: ir-9 - Information Spillage Response
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization responds to information spills by:
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.a}} - Identifying the specific information involved in the information system contamination;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.b}} - Alerting {{ ir-9_prm_1 }} of the information spill using a method of communication not associated with the spill;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.c}} - Isolating the contaminated information system or system component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.d}} - Eradicating the information from the contaminated information system or component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.e}} - Identifying other information systems or system components that may have been subsequently contaminated; and
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.f}} - Performing other {{ ir-9_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{ir-9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ir-9.a_obj}} - responds to information spills by identifying the specific information causing the information system contamination;
    • objective: {{ir-9.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-9.b_obj.1}} - defines personnel to be alerted of the information spillage;
      • objective: {{ir-9.b_obj.2}} - identifies a method of communication not associated with the information spill to use to alert organization-defined personnel of the spill;
      • objective: {{ir-9.b_obj.3}} - responds to information spills by alerting organization-defined personnel of the information spill using a method of communication not associated with the spill;
    • objective: {{ir-9.c_obj}} - responds to information spills by isolating the contaminated information system;
    • objective: {{ir-9.d_obj}} - responds to information spills by eradicating the information from the contaminated information system;
    • objective: {{ir-9.e_obj}} - responds to information spills by identifying other information systems that may have been subsequently contaminated;
    • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj.1}} - defines other actions to be performed in response to information spills; and
      • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj.2}} - responds to information spills by performing other organization-defined actions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-1 - System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ma-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.1}} - A system maintenance policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system maintenance policy and associated system maintenance controls; and
    • item: {{ma-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.b.1}} - System maintenance policy {{ ma-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.b.2}} - System maintenance procedures {{ ma-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ma-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a system maintenance policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the system maintenance policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the system maintenance policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ma-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the maintenance policy and associated system maintenance controls;
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ma-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ma-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ma-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current system maintenance policy;
        • objective: {{ma-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current system maintenance policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ma-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ma-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current system maintenance procedures; and
        • objective: {{ma-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current system maintenance procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-2 - Controlled Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.a}} - Schedules, performs, documents, and reviews records of maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with manufacturer or vendor specifications and/or organizational requirements;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.b}} - Approves and monitors all maintenance activities, whether performed on site or remotely and whether the equipment is serviced on site or removed to another location;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.c}} - Requires that {{ ma-2_prm_1 }} explicitly approve the removal of the information system or system components from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.d}} - Sanitizes equipment to remove all information from associated media prior to removal from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.e}} - Checks all potentially impacted security controls to verify that the controls are still functioning properly following maintenance or repair actions; and
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.f}} - Includes {{ ma-2_prm_2 }} in organizational maintenance records.
  • ID: {{ma-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.1}} - schedules maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with:
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.1.a}} - manufacturer or vendor specifications; and/or
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.1.b}} - organizational requirements;
      • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.2}} - performs maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with:
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.2.a}} - manufacturer or vendor specifications; and/or
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.2.b}} - organizational requirements;
      • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.3}} - documents maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with:
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.3.a}} - manufacturer or vendor specifications; and/or
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.3.b}} - organizational requirements;
      • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.4}} - reviews records of maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with:
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.4.a}} - manufacturer or vendor specifications; and/or
        • objective: {{ma-2.a_obj.4.b}} - organizational requirements;
    • objective: {{ma-2.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-2.b_obj.1}} - approves all maintenance activities, whether performed on site or remotely and whether the equipment is serviced on site or removed to another location;
      • objective: {{ma-2.b_obj.2}} - monitors all maintenance activities, whether performed on site or remotely and whether the equipment is serviced on site or removed to another location;
    • objective: {{ma-2.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-2.c_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles required to explicitly approve the removal of the information system or system components from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs;
      • objective: {{ma-2.c_obj.2}} - requires that organization-defined personnel or roles explicitly approve the removal of the information system or system components from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs;
    • objective: {{ma-2.d_obj}} - sanitizes equipment to remove all information from associated media prior to removal from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs;
    • objective: {{ma-2.e_obj}} - checks all potentially impacted security controls to verify that the controls are still functioning properly following maintenance or repair actions;
    • objective: {{ma-2.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-2.f_obj.1}} - defines maintenance-related information to be included in organizational maintenance records; and
      • objective: {{ma-2.f_obj.2}} - includes organization-defined maintenance-related information in organizational maintenance records.


  • Guidance

    • #cm-4, related
    • #ma-4, related
    • #mp-6, related
    • #pe-16, related
    • #sa-12, related
    • #si-2, related

  • {{ma-2.2}} - Automated Maintenance Activities

securityControls.title: ma-2.1 - Record Content
ma-2.2 - Automated Maintenance Activities
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-2.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-2.2_smt.a}} - Employs automated mechanisms to schedule, conduct, and document maintenance and repairs; and
    • item: {{ma-2.2_smt.b}} - Produces up-to date, accurate, and complete records of all maintenance and repair actions requested, scheduled, in process, and completed.
  • ID: {{ma-2.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-2.2.a_obj}} - employs automated mechanisms to:
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.a_obj.1}} - schedule maintenance and repairs;
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.a_obj.2}} - conduct maintenance and repairs;
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.a_obj.3}} - document maintenance and repairs;
    • objective: {{ma-2.2.b_obj}} - produces up-to-date, accurate, and complete records of all maintenance and repair actions:
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.b_obj.1}} - requested;
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.b_obj.2}} - scheduled;
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.b_obj.3}} - in process; and
      • objective: {{ma-2.2.b_obj.4}} - completed.


  • Guidance
    • #ca-7, related
    • #ma-3, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing controlled maintenance automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing production of records of maintenance and repair actions

securityControls.title: ma-3.1 - Inspect Tools

• ID: {{ma-3.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization inspects the maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.

securityControls.title: ma-3.3 - Prevent Unauthorized Removal
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization prevents the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing organizational information by:
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.a}} - Verifying that there is no organizational information contained on the equipment;
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.b}} - Sanitizing or destroying the equipment;
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.c}} - Retaining the equipment within the facility; or
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.d}} - Obtaining an exemption from {{ ma-3.3_prm_1 }} explicitly authorizing removal of the equipment from the facility.
  • ID: {{ma-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization prevents the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing organizational information by:
    • objective: {{ma-3.3.a_obj}} - verifying that there is no organizational information contained on the equipment;
    • objective: {{ma-3.3.b_obj}} - sanitizing or destroying the equipment;
    • objective: {{ma-3.3.c_obj}} - retaining the equipment within the facility; or
    • objective: {{ma-3.3.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-3.3.d_obj.1}} - defining personnel or roles that can grant an exemption from explicitly authorizing removal of the equipment from the facility; and
      • objective: {{ma-3.3.d_obj.2}} - obtaining an exemption from organization-defined personnel or roles explicitly authorizing removal of the equipment from the facility.


  • Guidance

Parameters
{{ma-3.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined personnel or roles
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational process for preventing unauthorized removal of information automated mechanisms supporting media sanitization or destruction of equipment automated mechanisms supporting verification of media sanitization

securityControls.title: ma-3.4 - Restricted Tool Use
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-3.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system restricts the use of maintenance tools to authorized personnel only.
  • ID: {{ma-3.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization restricts the use of maintenance tools to authorized personnel only.

securityControls.title: ma-4 - Nonlocal Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.a}} - Approves and monitors nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.b}} - Allows the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only as consistent with organizational policy and documented in the security plan for the information system;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.c}} - Employs strong authenticators in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.d}} - Maintains records for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities; and
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.e}} - Terminates session and network connections when nonlocal maintenance is completed.
  • ID: {{ma-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.a_obj.1}} - approves nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities;
      • objective: {{ma-4.a_obj.2}} - monitors nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities;
    • objective: {{ma-4.b_obj}} - allows the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only:
      • objective: {{ma-4.b_obj.1}} - as consistent with organizational policy;
      • objective: {{ma-4.b_obj.2}} - as documented in the security plan for the information system;
    • objective: {{ma-4.c_obj}} - employs strong authenticators in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions;
    • objective: {{ma-4.d_obj}} - maintains records for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities;
    • objective: {{ma-4.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.e_obj.1}} - terminates sessions when nonlocal maintenance or diagnostics is completed; and
      • objective: {{ma-4.e_obj.2}} - terminates network connections when nonlocal maintenance or diagnostics is completed.

securityControls.title: ma-4.1 - Auditing and Review
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-4.1_smt.a}} - Audits nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions {{ ma-4.1_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ma-4.1_smt.b}} - Reviews the records of the maintenance and diagnostic sessions.
  • ID: {{ma-4.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-4.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.1.a_obj.1}} - defines audit events to audit nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions;
      • objective: {{ma-4.1.a_obj.2}} - audits organization-defined audit events for non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions; and
    • objective: {{ma-4.1.b_obj}} - reviews records of the maintenance and diagnostic sessions.


  • Guidance
    • #au-2, related
    • #au-6, related
    • #au-12, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined audit events
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for audit and review of nonlocal maintenance automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing audit and review of nonlocal maintenance

securityControls.title: ma-4.2 - Document Nonlocal Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization documents in the security plan for the information system, the policies and procedures for the establishment and use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic connections.
  • ID: {{ma-4.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization documents in the security plan for the information system:
    • objective: {{ma-4.2_obj.1}} - the policies for the establishment and use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic connections; and
    • objective: {{ma-4.2_obj.2}} - the procedures for the establishment and use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic connections.
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: INTERVIEW
      • Organizational personnel with information system maintenance responsibilities organizational personnel with information security responsibilities

securityControls.title: ma-4.3 - Comparable Security / Sanitization
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-4.3_smt.a}} - Requires that nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic services be performed from an information system that implements a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced; or
    • item: {{ma-4.3_smt.b}} - Removes the component to be serviced from the information system prior to nonlocal maintenance or diagnostic services, sanitizes the component (with regard to organizational information) before removal from organizational facilities, and after the service is performed, inspects and sanitizes the component (with regard to potentially malicious software) before reconnecting the component to the information system.
  • ID: {{ma-4.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-4.3.a_obj}} - requires that nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic services be performed from an information system that implements a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced; or
    • objective: {{ma-4.3.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.3.b_obj.1}} - removes the component to be serviced from the information system;
      • objective: {{ma-4.3.b_obj.2}} - sanitizes the component (with regard to organizational information) prior to nonlocal maintenance or diagnostic services and/or before removal from organizational facilities; and
      • objective: {{ma-4.3.b_obj.3}} - inspects and sanitizes the component (with regard to potentially malicious software) after service is performed on the component and before reconnecting the component to the information system.


  • Guidance
    • #ma-3, related
    • #sa-12, related
    • #si-3, related
    • #si-7, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for comparable security and sanitization for nonlocal maintenance organizational processes for removal, sanitization, and inspection of components serviced via nonlocal maintenance automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing component sanitization and inspection

securityControls.title: ma-4.4 - Authentication / Separation of Maintenance Sessions
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization protects nonlocal maintenance sessions by:
    • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.a}} - Employing {{ ma-4.4_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b}} - Separating the maintenance sessions from other network sessions with the information system by either:
      • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b.1}} - Physically separated communications paths; or
      • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b.2}} - Logically separated communications paths based upon encryption.
  • ID: {{ma-4.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization protects nonlocal maintenance sessions by:
    • objective: {{ma-4.4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.4.a_obj.1}} - defining replay resistant authenticators to be employed to protect nonlocal maintenance sessions;
      • objective: {{ma-4.4.a_obj.2}} - employing organization-defined authenticators that are replay resistant;
    • objective: {{ma-4.4.b_obj}} - separating the maintenance sessions from other network sessions with the information system by either:
      • objective: {{ma-4.4.b.1_obj}} - physically separated communications paths; or
      • objective: {{ma-4.4.b.2_obj}} - logically separated communications paths based upon encryption.


  • Guidance
    • #sc-13, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined authenticators that are replay resistant
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for protecting nonlocal maintenance sessions automated mechanisms implementing replay resistant authenticators automated mechanisms implementing logically separated/encrypted communications paths

securityControls.title: ma-4.5 - Approvals and Notifications
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-4.5_smt.a}} - Requires the approval of each nonlocal maintenance session by {{ ma-4.5_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ma-4.5_smt.b}} - Notifies {{ ma-4.5_prm_2 }} of the date and time of planned nonlocal maintenance.
  • ID: {{ma-4.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-4.5.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.5.a_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles required to approve each nonlocal maintenance session;
      • objective: {{ma-4.5.a_obj.2}} - requires the approval of each nonlocal maintenance session by organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ma-4.5.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ma-4.5.b_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to be notified of the date and time of planned nonlocal maintenance; and

securityControls.title: ma-5 - Maintenance Personnel
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-5_smt.a}} - Establishes a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintains a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel;
    • item: {{ma-5_smt.b}} - Ensures that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance on the information system have required access authorizations; and
    • item: {{ma-5_smt.c}} - Designates organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.
  • ID: {{ma-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
