securityControls.title: ma-5.1 - Individuals Without Appropriate Access
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a}} - Implements procedures for the use of maintenance personnel that lack appropriate security clearances or are not U.S. citizens, that include the following requirements:
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.1}} - Maintenance personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals are escorted and supervised during the performance of maintenance and diagnostic activities on the information system by approved organizational personnel who are fully cleared, have appropriate access authorizations, and are technically qualified;
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.2}} - Prior to initiating maintenance or diagnostic activities by personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals, all volatile information storage components within the information system are sanitized and all nonvolatile storage media are removed or physically disconnected from the system and secured; and
    • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.b}} - Develops and implements alternate security safeguards in the event an information system component cannot be sanitized, removed, or disconnected from the system.
  • ID: {{ma-5.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ma-5.1.a_obj}} - implements procedures for the use of maintenance personnel that lack appropriate security clearances or are not U.S. citizens, that include the following requirements:
      • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj}} - maintenance personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals are escorted and supervised during the performance of maintenance and diagnostic activities on the information system by approved organizational personnel who:
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.1}} - are fully cleared;
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.2}} - have appropriate access authorizations;
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.3}} - are technically qualified;
      • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj}} - prior to initiating maintenance or diagnostic activities by personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals:
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.1}} - all volatile information storage components within the information system are sanitized; and
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.2}} - all nonvolatile storage media are removed; or
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.3}} - all nonvolatile storage media are physically disconnected from the system and secured; and
    • objective: {{ma-5.1.b_obj}} - develops and implements alternative security safeguards in the event an information system component cannot be sanitized, removed, or disconnected from the system.


  • Guidance
    • #mp-6, related
    • #pl-2, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for managing maintenance personnel without appropriate access automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing alternative security safeguards automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing information storage component sanitization

securityControls.title: ma-5.2 - Security Clearances for Classified Systems
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that personnel performing maintenance and diagnostic activities on an information system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information possess security clearances and formal access approvals for at least the highest classification level and for all compartments of information on the system.
  • ID: {{ma-5.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization ensures that personnel performing maintenance and diagnostic activities on an information system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information possess:
    • objective: {{ma-5.2_obj.1}} - security clearances for at least the highest classification level on the system;
    • objective: {{ma-5.2_obj.2}} - security clearances for all compartments of information on the system;
    • objective: {{ma-5.2_obj.3}} - formal access approvals for at least the highest classification level on the system; and
    • objective: {{ma-5.2_obj.4}} - formal access approvals for all compartments of information on the system.

securityControls.title: ma-5.4 - Foreign Nationals
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that:
    • item: {{ma-5.4_smt.a}} - Cleared foreign nationals (i.e., foreign nationals with appropriate security clearances), are used to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified information systems only when the systems are jointly owned and operated by the United States and foreign allied governments, or owned and operated solely by foreign allied governments; and
    • item: {{ma-5.4_smt.b}} - Approvals, consents, and detailed operational conditions regarding the use of foreign nationals to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified information systems are fully documented within Memoranda of Agreements.
  • ID: {{ma-5.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization ensures that:
    • objective: {{ma-5.4.a_obj}} - cleared foreign nationals (i.e., foreign nationals with appropriate security clearances) are used to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified information systems only when the systems are:
      • objective: {{ma-5.4.a_obj.1}} - jointly owned and operated by the United States and foreign allied governments; or
      • objective: {{ma-5.4.a_obj.2}} - owned and operated solely by foreign allied governments; and
    • objective: {{ma-5.4.b_obj}} - approvals, consents, and detailed operational conditions regarding the use of foreign nationals to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified information systems are fully documented within Memoranda of Agreements.

securityControls.title: mp-1 - Media Protection Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{mp-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{mp-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ mp-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.1}} - A media protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls; and
    • item: {{mp-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.b.1}} - Media protection policy {{ mp-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.b.2}} - Media protection procedures {{ mp-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{mp-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{mp-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a media protection policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the media protection policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the media protection policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{mp-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls;
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{mp-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{mp-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{mp-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{mp-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current media protection policy;
        • objective: {{mp-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current media protection policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{mp-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{mp-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current media protection procedures; and
        • objective: {{mp-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current media protection procedures with the organization-defined frequency.

securityControls.title: mp-6 - Media Sanitization
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{mp-6_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{mp-6_smt.a}} - Sanitizes {{ mp-6_prm_1 }} prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse using {{ mp-6_prm_2 }} in accordance with applicable federal and organizational standards and policies; and

        • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.1.c}} - release for reuse;
      • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.2}} - defines sanitization techniques or procedures to be used for sanitizing organization-defined information system media prior to:
        • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.2.a}} - disposal;
        • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.2.b}} - release out of organizational control; or
        • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.2.c}} - release for reuse;
      • objective: {{mp-6.a_obj.3}} - sanitizes organization-defined information system media prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse using organization-defined sanitization techniques or procedures in accordance with applicable federal and organizational standards and policies; and
    • objective: {{mp-6.b_obj}} - employs sanitization mechanisms with strength and integrity commensurate with the security category or classification of the information.

    • item: {{mp-8_smt.c}} - Identifies {{ mp-8_prm_3 }}; and

    • objective: {{mp-8.b_obj}} - ensures that the information system media downgrading process is commensurate with the:
      • objective: {{mp-8.b_obj.1}} - security category and/or classification level of the information to be removed;

securityControls.title: pe-1 - Physical and Environmental Protection Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pe-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ pe-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.1}} - A physical and environmental protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the physical and environmental protection policy and associated physical and environmental protection controls; and
    • item: {{pe-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.b.1}} - Physical and environmental protection policy {{ pe-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.b.2}} - Physical and environmental protection procedures {{ pe-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{pe-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a physical and environmental protection policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the physical and environmental protection policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the physical and environmental protection policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{pe-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the physical and environmental protection policy and associated physical and environmental protection controls;
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{pe-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{pe-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{pe-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current physical and environmental protection policy;
        • objective: {{pe-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current physical and environmental protection policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{pe-1.b.2_obj}}

    • item: {{pe-3_smt.b}} - Maintains physical access audit logs for {{ pe-3_prm_4 }};
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.c}} - Provides {{ pe-3_prm_5 }} to control access to areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible;
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.d}} - Escorts visitors and monitors visitor activity {{ pe-3_prm_6 }};
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.e}} - Secures keys, combinations, and other physical access devices;
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.f}} - Inventories {{ pe-3_prm_7 }} every {{ pe-3_prm_8 }}; and
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.g}} - Changes combinations and keys {{ pe-3_prm_9 }} and/or when keys are lost, combinations are compromised, or individuals are transferred or terminated.
  • ID: {{pe-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.a_obj.1}} - defines entry/exit points to the facility where the information system resides;
      • objective: {{pe-3.a_obj.2}} - enforces physical access authorizations at organization-defined entry/exit points to the facility where the information system resides by:
        • objective: {{pe-3.a.1_obj.2}} - verifying individual access authorizations before granting access to the facility;
        • objective: {{pe-3.a.2_obj.2}}
          • objective: {{pe-3.a.2_obj.2.a}} - defining physical access control systems/devices to be employed to control ingress/egress to the facility where the information system resides;
          • objective: {{pe-3.a.2_obj.2.b}} - using one or more of the following ways to control ingress/egress to the facility:
            • objective: {{pe-3.a.2_obj.2.b.1}} - organization-defined physical access control systems/devices; and/or
            • objective: {{pe-3.a.2_obj.2.b.2}} - guards;
    • objective: {{pe-3.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.b_obj.1}} - defines entry/exit points for which physical access audit logs are to be maintained;
      • objective: {{pe-3.b_obj.2}} - maintains physical access audit logs for organization-defined entry/exit points;
    • objective: {{pe-3.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.c_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to control access to areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible;
      • objective: {{pe-3.c_obj.2}} - provides organization-defined security safeguards to control access to areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible;
    • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.1}} - defines circumstances requiring visitor:
        • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.1.a}} - escorts;
        • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.1.b}} - monitoring;
      • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.2}} - in accordance with organization-defined circumstances requiring visitor escorts and monitoring:
        • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.2.a}} - escorts visitors;
        • objective: {{pe-3.d_obj.2.b}} - monitors visitor activities;
    • objective: {{pe-3.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.e_obj.1}} - secures keys;
      • objective: {{pe-3.e_obj.2}} - secures combinations;
      • objective: {{pe-3.e_obj.3}} - secures other physical access devices;
    • objective: {{pe-3.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.f_obj.1}} - defines physical access devices to be inventoried;
      • objective: {{pe-3.f_obj.2}} - defines the frequency to inventory organization-defined physical access devices;
      • objective: {{pe-3.f_obj.3}} - inventories the organization-defined physical access devices with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to change combinations and keys; and
      • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj.2}} - changes combinations and keys with the organization-defined frequency and/or when:
        • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj.2.a}} - keys are lost;
        • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj.2.b}} - combinations are compromised;
        • objective: {{pe-3.g_obj.2.c}} - individuals are transferred or terminated.

securityControls.title: pe-3.1 - Information System Access
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-3.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization enforces physical access authorizations to the information system in addition to the physical access controls for the facility at {{ pe-3.1_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{pe-3.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-3.1_obj.1}} - defines physical spaces containing one or more components of the information system; and
    • objective: {{pe-3.1_obj.2}} - enforces physical access authorizations to the information system in addition to the physical access controls for the facility at organization-defined physical spaces containing one or more components of the information system.

securityControls.title: pe-3.2 - Facility / Information System Boundaries
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization performs security checks {{ pe-3.2_prm_1 }} at the physical boundary of the facility or information system for unauthorized exfiltration of information or removal of information system components.
  • ID: {{pe-3.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to perform security checks at the physical boundary of the facility or information system for:
      • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.1.a}} - unauthorized exfiltration of information; or
      • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.1.b}} - removal of information system components; and
    • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.2}} - performs security checks with the organization-defined frequency at the physical boundary of the facility or information system for:
      • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.2.a}} - unauthorized exfiltration of information; or
      • objective: {{pe-3.2_obj.2.b}} - removal of information system components.


  • Guidance
    • #ac-4, related
    • #sc-7, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{pe-3.2_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for physical access control to the facility and/or information system automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing physical access control for the facility or information system automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing security checks for unauthorized exfiltration of information

securityControls.title: pe-3.3 - Continuous Guards / Alarms / Monitoring
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs guards and/or alarms to monitor every physical access point to the facility where the information system resides 24 hours per day, 7 days per week.
  • ID: {{pe-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization employs one or more of the following to monitor every physical access point to the facility where the information system resides 24 hours per day, 7 days per week:
    • objective: {{pe-3.3_obj.1}} - guards; and/or
    • objective: {{pe-3.3_obj.2}} - alarms.


  • Guidance

    • #cp-7, related

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-3.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization uses lockable physical casings to protect {{ pe-3.4_prm_1 }} from unauthorized physical access.

    • objective: {{pe-3.4_obj.1}} - defines information system components to be protected from unauthorized physical access using lockable physical casings; and
    • objective: {{pe-3.4_obj.2}} - uses lockable physical casings to protect organization-defined information system components from unauthorized physical access.

securityControls.title: pe-3.5 - Tamper Protection

• ID: {{pe-3.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ pe-3.5_prm_1 }} to {{ pe-3.5_prm_2 }} physical tampering or alteration of {{ pe-3.5_prm_3 }} within the information system.
  • ID: {{pe-3.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-3.5_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to detect and/or prevent physical tampering or alteration of organization-defined hardware components within the information system;
    • objective: {{pe-3.5_obj.2}} - defines hardware components within the information system for which security safeguards are to be employed to detect and/or prevent physical tampering or alteration of such components;
    • objective: {{pe-3.5_obj.3}} - employs organization-defined security safeguards to do one or more of the following:
      • objective: {{pe-3.5_obj.3.a}} - detect physical tampering or alteration of organization-defined hardware components within the information system; and/or
      • objective: {{pe-3.5_obj.3.b}} - prevent physical tampering or alteration of organization-defined hardware components within the information system.

securityControls.title: pe-10 - Emergency Shutoff
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-10_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pe-10_smt.a}} - Provides the capability of shutting off power to the information system or individual system components in emergency situations;
    • item: {{pe-10_smt.b}} - Places emergency shutoff switches or devices in {{ pe-10_prm_1 }} to facilitate safe and easy access for personnel; and
    • item: {{pe-10_smt.c}} - Protects emergency power shutoff capability from unauthorized activation.
  • ID: {{pe-10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pe-10.a_obj}} - provides the capability of shutting off power to the information system or individual system components in emergency situations;
    • objective: {{pe-10.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-10.b_obj.1}} - defines the location of emergency shutoff switches or devices by information system or system component;
      • objective: {{pe-10.b_obj.2}} - places emergency shutoff switches or devices in the organization-defined location by information system or system component to facilitate safe and easy access for personnel; and
    • objective: {{pe-10.c_obj}} - protects emergency power shutoff capability from unauthorized activation.

pe-11 - Emergency Power

securityControls.title: pe-13 - Fire Protection

securityControls.title: pe-14 - Temperature and Humidity Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pe-14_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:

  • ID: {{pe-14_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

      • objective: {{pe-14.a_obj.2}} - defines acceptable humidity levels to be maintained within the facility where the information system resides;
      • objective: {{pe-14.a_obj.3}} - maintains temperature levels within the facility where the information system resides at the organization-defined levels;
      • objective: {{pe-14.a_obj.4}} - maintains humidity levels within the facility where the information system resides at the organization-defined levels;
    • objective: {{pe-14.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pe-14.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to monitor temperature levels;
      • objective: {{pe-14.b_obj.2}} - defines the frequency to monitor humidity levels;
      • objective: {{pe-14.b_obj.3}} - monitors temperature levels with the organization-defined frequency; and
      • objective: {{pe-14.b_obj.4}} - monitors humidity levels with the organization-defined frequency.

      • item: {{pl-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security planning policy and associated security planning controls; and
    • item: {{pl-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{pl-1_smt.b.1}} - Security planning policy {{ pl-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{pl-1_smt.b.2}} - Security planning procedures {{ pl-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{pl-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-1.a_obj}}

securityControls.title: pl-2 - System Security Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.a}} - Develops a security plan for the information system that:
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.1}} - Is consistent with the organization’s enterprise architecture;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.2}} - Explicitly defines the authorization boundary for the system;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.3}} - Describes the operational context of the information system in terms of missions and business processes;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.4}} - Provides the security categorization of the information system including supporting rationale;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.5}} - Describes the operational environment for the information system and relationships with or connections to other information systems;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.6}} - Provides an overview of the security requirements for the system;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.7}} - Identifies any relevant overlays, if applicable;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.8}} - Describes the security controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements including a rationale for the tailoring decisions; and
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.9}} - Is reviewed and approved by the authorizing official or designated representative prior to plan implementation;
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.b}} - Distributes copies of the security plan and communicates subsequent changes to the plan to {{ pl-2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.c}} - Reviews the security plan for the information system {{ pl-2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.d}} - Updates the plan to address changes to the information system/environment of operation or problems identified during plan implementation or security control assessments; and
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.e}} - Protects the security plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.
  • ID: {{pl-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-2.a_obj}} - develops a security plan for the information system that:
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.1_obj}} - is consistent with the organization’s enterprise architecture;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.2_obj}} - explicitly defines the authorization boundary for the system;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.3_obj}} - describes the operational context of the information system in terms of missions and business processes;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.4_obj}} - provides the security categorization of the information system including supporting rationale;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.5_obj}} - describes the operational environment for the information system and relationships with or connections to other information systems;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.6_obj}} - provides an overview of the security requirements for the system;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.7_obj}} - identifies any relevant overlays, if applicable;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.8_obj}} - describes the security controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements including a rationale for the tailoring and supplemental decisions;
      • objective: {{pl-2.a.9_obj}} - is reviewed and approved by the authorizing official or designated representative prior to plan implementation;
    • objective: {{pl-2.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-2.b_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to whom copies of the security plan are to be distributed and subsequent changes to the plan are to be communicated;
      • objective: {{pl-2.b_obj.2}} - distributes copies of the security plan and communicates subsequent changes to the plan to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{pl-2.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-2.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review the security plan for the information system;
      • objective: {{pl-2.c_obj.2}} - reviews the security plan for the information system with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{pl-2.d_obj}} - updates the plan to address:
      • objective: {{pl-2.d_obj.1}} - changes to the information system/environment of operation;
      • objective: {{pl-2.d_obj.2}} - problems identified during plan implementation;
      • objective: {{pl-2.d_obj.3}} - problems identified during security control assessments;
    • objective: {{pl-2.e_obj}} - protects the security plan from unauthorized:
      • objective: {{pl-2.e_obj.1}} - disclosure; and
      • objective: {{pl-2.e_obj.2}} - modification.

pl-2.3 - Plan / Coordinate with Other Organizational Entities
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-2.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization plans and coordinates security-related activities affecting the information system with {{ pl-2.3_prm_1 }} before conducting such activities in order to reduce the impact on other organizational entities.
  • ID: {{pl-2.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-2.3_obj.1}} - defines individuals or groups with whom security-related activities affecting the information system are to be planned and coordinated before conducting such activities in order to reduce the impact on other organizational entities; and
    • objective: {{pl-2.3_obj.2}} - plans and coordinates security-related activities affecting the information system with organization-defined individuals or groups before conducting such activities in order to reduce the impact on other organizational entities.

securityControls.title: pl-3 - System Security Plan Update
pl-4 - Rules of Behavior
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.a}} - Establishes and makes readily available to individuals requiring access to the information system, the rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior with regard to information and information system usage;
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.b}} - Receives a signed acknowledgment from such individuals, indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior, before authorizing access to information and the information system;
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.c}} - Reviews and updates the rules of behavior {{ pl-4_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.d}} - Requires individuals who have signed a previous version of the rules of behavior to read and re-sign when the rules of behavior are revised/updated.
  • ID: {{pl-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-4.a_obj.1}} - establishes, for individuals requiring access to the information system, the rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior with regard to information and information system usage;
      • objective: {{pl-4.a_obj.2}} - makes readily available to individuals requiring access to the information system, the rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior with regard to information and information system usage;
    • objective: {{pl-4.b_obj}} - receives a signed acknowledgement from such individuals, indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior, before authorizing access to information and the information system;
    • objective: {{pl-4.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-4.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the rules of behavior;
      • objective: {{pl-4.c_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the rules of behavior with the organization-defined frequency; and
    • objective: {{pl-4.d_obj}} - requires individuals who have signed a previous version of the rules of behavior to read and resign when the rules of behavior are revised/updated.

securityControls.title: pl-8 - Information Security Architecture
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pl-8_smt.a}} - Develops an information security architecture for the information system that:
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.1}} - Describes the overall philosophy, requirements, and approach to be taken with regard to protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational information;
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.2}} - Describes how the information security architecture is integrated into and supports the enterprise architecture; and
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.3}} - Describes any information security assumptions about, and dependencies on, external services;
    • item: {{pl-8_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the information security architecture {{ pl-8_prm_1 }} to reflect updates in the enterprise architecture; and
    • item: {{pl-8_smt.c}} - Ensures that planned information security architecture changes are reflected in the security plan, the security Concept of Operations (CONOPS), and organizational procurements/acquisitions.
  • ID: {{pl-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-8.a_obj}} - develops an information security architecture for the information system that describes:
      • objective: {{pl-8.a.1_obj}} - the overall philosophy, requirements, and approach to be taken with regard to protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational information;
      • objective: {{pl-8.a.2_obj}} - how the information security architecture is integrated into and supports the enterprise architecture;
      • objective: {{pl-8.a.3_obj}} - any information security assumptions about, and dependencies on, external services;
    • objective: {{pl-8.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-8.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the information security architecture;
      • objective: {{pl-8.b_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the information security architecture with the organization-defined frequency to reflect updates in the enterprise architecture;
    • objective: {{pl-8.c_obj}} - ensures that planned information security architecture changes are reflected in:
      • objective: {{pl-8.c_obj.1}} - the security plan;
      • objective: {{pl-8.c_obj.2}} - the security Concept of Operations (CONOPS); and
      • objective: {{pl-8.c_obj.3}} - the organizational procurements/acquisitions.

securityControls.title: pl-8.1 - Defense-in-depth
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-8.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization designs its security architecture using a defense-in-depth approach that:
    • item: {{pl-8.1_smt.a}} - Allocates {{ pl-8.1_prm_1 }} to {{ pl-8.1_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{pl-8.1_smt.b}} - Ensures that the allocated security safeguards operate in a coordinated and mutually reinforcing manner.
  • ID: {{pl-8.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pl-8.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{pl-8.1.a_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be allocated to locations and architectural layers within the design of its security architecture;
      • objective: {{pl-8.1.a_obj.2}} - defines locations and architectural layers of its security architecture in which organization-defined security safeguards are to be allocated;
      • objective: {{pl-8.1.a_obj.3}} - designs its security architecture using a defense-in-depth approach that allocates organization-defined security safeguards to organization-defined locations and architectural layers; and
    • objective: {{pl-8.1.b_obj}} - designs its security architecture using a defense-in-depth approach that ensures the allocated organization-defined security safeguards operate in a coordinated and mutually reinforcing manner.

    • #sc-36, related

      • objective: {{ps-3.b_obj.2}} - defines the frequency of re-screening where it is so indicated; and
      • objective: {{ps-3.b_obj.3}} - re-screens individuals in accordance with organization-defined conditions requiring re-screening and, where re-screening is so indicated, with the organization-defined frequency of such re-screening.

securityControls.title: ps-3.1 - Classified Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information are cleared and indoctrinated to the highest classification level of the information to which they have access on the system.
  • ID: {{ps-3.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ps-3.1_obj.1}} - ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information are cleared to the highest classification level of the information to which they have access on the system; and
    • objective: {{ps-3.1_obj.2}} - ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information are indoctrinated to the highest classification level of the information to which they have access on the system.

securityControls.title: ps-3.2 - Formal Indoctrination
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting types of classified information which require formal indoctrination, are formally indoctrinated for all of the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system.
  • ID: {{ps-3.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting types of classified information which require formal indoctrination, are formally indoctrinated for all of the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system.

securityControls.title: ps-3.3 - Information with Special Protection Measures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection:
    • item: {{ps-3.3_smt.a}} - Have valid access authorizations that are demonstrated by assigned official government duties; and
    • item: {{ps-3.3_smt.b}} - Satisfy {{ ps-3.3_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{ps-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ps-3.3.a_obj}} - ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection have valid access authorizations that are demonstrated by assigned official government duties;
    • objective: {{ps-3.3.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-3.3.b_obj.1}} - defines additional personnel screening criteria to be satisfied for individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection; and
      • objective: {{ps-3.3.b_obj.2}} - ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection satisfy organization-defined additional personnel screening criteria.

securityControls.title: ps-4 - Personnel Termination
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization, upon termination of individual employment:
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.a}} - Disables information system access within {{ ps-4_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.b}} - Terminates/revokes any authenticators/credentials associated with the individual;
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.c}} - Conducts exit interviews that include a discussion of {{ ps-4_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.d}} - Retrieves all security-related organizational information system-related property;
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.e}} - Retains access to organizational information and information systems formerly controlled by terminated individual; and
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.f}} - Notifies {{ ps-4_prm_3 }} within {{ ps-4_prm_4 }}.
  • ID: {{ps-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization, upon termination of individual employment,:
    • objective: {{ps-4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-4.a_obj.1}} - defines a time period within which to disable information system access;
      • objective: {{ps-4.a_obj.2}} - disables information system access within the organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{ps-4.b_obj}} - terminates/revokes any authenticators/credentials associated with the individual;
    • objective: {{ps-4.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-4.c_obj.1}} - defines information security topics to be discussed when conducting exit interviews;
      • objective: {{ps-4.c_obj.2}} - conducts exit interviews that include a discussion of organization-defined information security topics;
    • objective: {{ps-4.d_obj}} - retrieves all security-related organizational information system-related property;
    • objective: {{ps-4.e_obj}} - retains access to organizational information and information systems formerly controlled by the terminated individual;
    • objective: {{ps-4.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-4.f_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to be notified of the termination;
      • objective: {{ps-4.f_obj.2}} - defines the time period within which to notify organization-defined personnel or roles; and
      • objective: {{ps-4.f_obj.3}} - notifies organization-defined personnel or roles within the organization-defined time period.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ps-5 - Personnel Transfer
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ps-5_smt.a}} - Reviews and confirms ongoing operational need for current logical and physical access authorizations to information systems/facilities when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization;
    • item: {{ps-5_smt.b}} - Initiates {{ ps-5_prm_1 }} within {{ ps-5_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ps-5_smt.c}} - Modifies access authorization as needed to correspond with any changes in operational need due to reassignment or transfer; and
    • item: {{ps-5_smt.d}} - Notifies {{ ps-5_prm_3 }} within {{ ps-5_prm_4 }}.
  • ID: {{ps-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ps-5.a_obj}} - when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization, reviews and confirms ongoing operational need for current:
      • objective: {{ps-5.a_obj.1}} - logical access authorizations to information systems;
      • objective: {{ps-5.a_obj.2}} - physical access authorizations to information systems and facilities;
    • objective: {{ps-5.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-5.b_obj.1}} - defines transfer or reassignment actions to be initiated following transfer or reassignment;
      • objective: {{ps-5.b_obj.2}} - defines the time period within which transfer or reassignment actions must occur following transfer or reassignment;
      • objective: {{ps-5.b_obj.3}} - initiates organization-defined transfer or reassignment actions within the organization-defined time period following transfer or reassignment;
    • objective: {{ps-5.c_obj}} - modifies access authorization as needed to correspond with any changes in operational need due to reassignment or transfer;
    • objective: {{ps-5.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-5.d_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to be notified when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization;
      • objective: {{ps-5.d_obj.2}} - defines the time period within which to notify organization-defined personnel or roles when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization; and
      • objective: {{ps-5.d_obj.3}} - notifies organization-defined personnel or roles within the organization-defined time period when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization.

securityControls.title: ps-6 - Access Agreements
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-6_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ps-6_smt.a}} - Develops and documents access agreements for organizational information systems;
    • item: {{ps-6_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the access agreements {{ ps-6_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ps-6_smt.c}} - Ensures that individuals requiring access to organizational information and information systems:
      • item: {{ps-6_smt.c.1}} - Sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access; and
      • item: {{ps-6_smt.c.2}} - Re-sign access agreements to maintain access to organizational information systems when access agreements have been updated or {{ ps-6_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{ps-6_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ps-6.a_obj}} - develops and documents access agreements for organizational information systems;
    • objective: {{ps-6.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-6.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the access agreements;
      • objective: {{ps-6.b_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the access agreements with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{ps-6.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-6.c.1_obj}} - ensures that individuals requiring access to organizational information and information systems sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access;
      • objective: {{ps-6.c.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ps-6.c.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to re-sign access agreements to maintain access to organizational information systems when access agreements have been updated;
        • objective: {{ps-6.c.2_obj.2}} - ensures that individuals requiring access to organizational information and information systems re-sign access agreements to maintain access to organizational information systems when access agreements have been updated or with the organization-defined frequency.

• ID: {{ps-6.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization ensures that access to classified information requiring special protection is granted only to individuals who:

securityControls.title: ps-7 - Third-party Personnel Security
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.a}} - Establishes personnel security requirements including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers;
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.b}} - Requires third-party providers to comply with personnel security policies and procedures established by the organization;
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.c}} - Documents personnel security requirements;
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.d}} - Requires third-party providers to notify {{ ps-7_prm_1 }} of any personnel transfers or terminations of third-party personnel who possess organizational credentials and/or badges, or who have information system privileges within {{ ps-7_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.e}} - Monitors provider compliance.
  • ID: {{ps-7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ps-7.a_obj}} - establishes personnel security requirements, including security roles and responsibilities, for third-party providers;
    • objective: {{ps-7.b_obj}} - requires third-party providers to comply with personnel security policies and procedures established by the organization;
    • objective: {{ps-7.c_obj}} - documents personnel security requirements;
    • objective: {{ps-7.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ps-7.d_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to be notified of any personnel transfers or terminations of third-party personnel who possess organizational credentials and/or badges, or who have information system privileges;
      • objective: {{ps-7.d_obj.2}} - defines the time period within which third-party providers are required to notify organization-defined personnel or roles of any personnel transfers or terminations of third-party personnel who possess organizational credentials and/or badges, or who have information system privileges;
      • objective: {{ps-7.d_obj.3}} - requires third-party providers to notify organization-defined personnel or roles within the organization-defined time period of any personnel transfers or terminations of third-party personnel who possess organizational credentials and/or badges, or who have information system privileges; and
    • objective: {{ps-7.e_obj}} - monitors provider compliance.

securityControls.title: ps-8 - Personnel Sanctions
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ps-8_smt.a}} - Employs a formal sanctions process for individuals failing to comply with established information security policies and procedures; and

securityControls.title: ra-1 - Risk Assessment Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ra-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ra-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ra-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.1}} - A risk assessment policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the risk assessment policy and associated risk assessment controls; and
    • item: {{ra-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.b.1}} - Risk assessment policy {{ ra-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.b.2}} - Risk assessment procedures {{ ra-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ra-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ra-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a risk assessment policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the risk assessment policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the risk assessment policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ra-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the risk assessment policy and associated risk assessment controls;
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ra-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ra-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current risk assessment policy;
        • objective: {{ra-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current risk assessment policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ra-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current risk assessment procedures; and
        • objective: {{ra-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current risk assessment procedures with the organization-defined frequency.

securityControls.title: ra-2 - Security Categorization
securityControls.description:

    • item: {{ra-2_smt.a}} - Categorizes information and the information system in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance;
    • item: {{ra-2_smt.b}} - Documents the security categorization results (including supporting rationale) in the security plan for the information system; and
    • item: {{ra-2_smt.c}} - Ensures that the authorizing official or authorizing official designated representative reviews and approves the security categorization decision.

securityControls.title: ra-3 - Risk Assessment
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ra-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.a}} - Conducts an assessment of risk, including the likelihood and magnitude of harm, from the unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of the information system and the information it processes, stores, or transmits;
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.b}} - Documents risk assessment results in {{ ra-3_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.c}} - Reviews risk assessment results {{ ra-3_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.d}} - Disseminates risk assessment results to {{ ra-3_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.e}} - Updates the risk assessment {{ ra-3_prm_5 }} or whenever there are significant changes to the information system or environment of operation (including the identification of new threats and vulnerabilities), or other conditions that may impact the security state of the system.
  • ID: {{ra-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ra-3.a_obj}} - conducts an assessment of risk, including the likelihood and magnitude of harm, from the unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of:
      • objective: {{ra-3.a_obj.1}} - the information system;
      • objective: {{ra-3.a_obj.2}} - the information the system processes, stores, or transmits;
    • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj.1}} - defines a document in which risk assessment results are to be documented (if not documented in the security plan or risk assessment report);
      • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj.2}} - documents risk assessment results in one of the following:
        • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj.2.a}} - the security plan;
        • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj.2.b}} - the risk assessment report; or
        • objective: {{ra-3.b_obj.2.c}} - the organization-defined document;
    • objective: {{ra-3.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-3.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review risk assessment results;
      • objective: {{ra-3.c_obj.2}} - reviews risk assessment results with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{ra-3.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-3.d_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to whom risk assessment results are to be disseminated;
      • objective: {{ra-3.d_obj.2}} - disseminates risk assessment results to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to update the risk assessment;
      • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj.2}} - updates the risk assessment:
        • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj.2.a}} - with the organization-defined frequency;
        • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj.2.b}} - whenever there are significant changes to the information system or environment of operation (including the identification of new threats and vulnerabilities); and
        • objective: {{ra-3.e_obj.2.c}} - whenever there are other conditions that may impact the security state of the system.

    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: ra-4 - Risk Assessment Update
ra-5 - Vulnerability Scanning
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ra-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.a}} - Scans for vulnerabilities in the information system and hosted applications {{ ra-5_prm_1 }} and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system/applications are identified and reported;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.b}} - Employs vulnerability scanning tools and techniques that facilitate interoperability among tools and automate parts of the vulnerability management process by using standards for:
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.1}} - Enumerating platforms, software flaws, and improper configurations;
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.2}} - Formatting checklists and test procedures; and
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.3}} - Measuring vulnerability impact;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.c}} - Analyzes vulnerability scan reports and results from security control assessments;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.d}} - Remediates legitimate vulnerabilities {{ ra-5_prm_2 }} in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk; and
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.e}} - Shares information obtained from the vulnerability scanning process and security control assessments with {{ ra-5_prm_3 }} to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other information systems (i.e., systemic weaknesses or deficiencies).
  • ID: {{ra-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.1}}
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.1.a}} - defines the frequency for conducting vulnerability scans on the information system and hosted applications; and/or
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.1.b}} - defines the process for conducting random vulnerability scans on the information system and hosted applications;
      • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.2}} - in accordance with the organization-defined frequency and/or organization-defined process for conducting random scans, scans for vulnerabilities in:
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.2.a}} - the information system;
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.2.b}} - hosted applications;
      • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.3}} - when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system/applications are identified and reported, scans for vulnerabilities in:
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.3.a}} - the information system;
        • objective: {{ra-5.a_obj.3.b}} - hosted applications;
    • objective: {{ra-5.b_obj}} - employs vulnerability scanning tools and techniques that facilitate interoperability among tools and automate parts of the vulnerability management process by using standards for:
      • objective: {{ra-5.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-5.b.1_obj.1}} - enumerating platforms;
        • objective: {{ra-5.b.1_obj.2}} - enumerating software flaws;
        • objective: {{ra-5.b.1_obj.3}} - enumerating improper configurations;
      • objective: {{ra-5.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ra-5.b.2_obj.1}} - formatting checklists;
        • objective: {{ra-5.b.2_obj.2}} - formatting test procedures;
      • objective: {{ra-5.b.3_obj}} - measuring vulnerability impact;
    • objective: {{ra-5.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-5.c_obj.1}} - analyzes vulnerability scan reports;
      • objective: {{ra-5.c_obj.2}} - analyzes results from security control assessments;
    • objective: {{ra-5.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-5.d_obj.1}} - defines response times to remediate legitimate vulnerabilities in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk;
      • objective: {{ra-5.d_obj.2}} - remediates legitimate vulnerabilities within the organization-defined response times in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk;
    • objective: {{ra-5.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ra-5.e_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles with whom information obtained from the vulnerability scanning process and security control assessments is to be shared;
      • objective: {{ra-5.e_obj.2}} - shares information obtained from the vulnerability scanning process with organization-defined personnel or roles to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other information systems (i.e., systemic weaknesses or deficiencies); and
      • objective: {{ra-5.e_obj.3}} - shares information obtained from security control assessments with organization-defined personnel or roles to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other information systems (i.e., systemic weaknesses or deficiencies).

securityControls.title: sa-1 - System and Services Acquisition Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ sa-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{sa-1_smt.a.1}} - A system and services acquisition policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{sa-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and services acquisition policy and associated system and services acquisition controls; and
    • item: {{sa-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{sa-1_smt.b.1}} - System and services acquisition policy {{ sa-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{sa-1_smt.b.2}} - System and services acquisition procedures {{ sa-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a system and services acquisition policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the system and services acquisition policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the system and services acquisition policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{sa-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and services acquisition policy and associated system and services acquisition controls;
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{sa-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{sa-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current system and services acquisition policy;
        • objective: {{sa-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current system and services acquisition policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{sa-1.b.2_obj}}

securityControls.title: sa-2 - Allocation of Resources
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:

    • item: {{sa-2_smt.b}} - Determines, documents, and allocates the resources required to protect the information system or information system service as part of its capital planning and investment control process; and

      • objective: {{sa-2.b_obj.2}} - documents the resources required;
      • objective: {{sa-2.b_obj.3}} - allocates the resources required; and
    • objective: {{sa-2.c_obj}} - establishes a discrete line item for information security in organizational programming and budgeting documentation.

securityControls.title: sa-3 - System Development Life Cycle
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-3_smt.a}} - Manages the information system using {{ sa-3_prm_1 }} that incorporates information security considerations;
    • item: {{sa-3_smt.b}} - Defines and documents information security roles and responsibilities throughout the system development life cycle;
    • item: {{sa-3_smt.c}} - Identifies individuals having information security roles and responsibilities; and
    • item: {{sa-3_smt.d}} - Integrates the organizational information security risk management process into system development life cycle activities.
  • ID: {{sa-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

      • objective: {{sa-3.a_obj.2}} - manages the information system using the organization-defined system development life cycle;
    • objective: {{sa-3.b_obj}} - defines and documents information security roles and responsibilities throughout the system development life cycle;
    • objective: {{sa-3.c_obj}} - identifies individuals having information security roles and responsibilities; and
    • objective: {{sa-3.d_obj}} - integrates the organizational information security risk management process into system development life cycle activities.

securityControls.title: sa-4 - Acquisition Process
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization includes the following requirements, descriptions, and criteria, explicitly or by reference, in the acquisition contract for the information system, system component, or information system service in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, guidelines, and organizational mission/business needs:

    • item: {{sa-4_smt.b}} - Security strength requirements;

    • item: {{sa-4_smt.d}} - Security-related documentation requirements;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.e}} - Requirements for protecting security-related documentation;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.f}} - Description of the information system development environment and environment in which the system is intended to operate; and
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.g}} - Acceptance criteria.
