securityControls.title: sa-4.1 - Functional Properties of Security Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to provide a description of the functional properties of the security controls to be employed.
  • ID: {{sa-4.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to provide a description of the functional properties of the security controls to be employed.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-5, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for determining information system security functional, requirements organizational processes for developing acquisition contracts automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing acquisitions and inclusion of security requirements in contracts

securityControls.title: sa-4.2 - Design / Implementation Information for Security Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to provide design and implementation information for the security controls to be employed that includes: {{ sa-4.2_prm_1 }} at {{ sa-4.2_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-4.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.1}} - defines level of detail that the developer is required to provide in design and implementation information for the security controls to be employed in the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.2}} - defines design/implementation information that the developer is to provide for the security controls to be employed (if selected);
    • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to provide design and implementation information for the security controls to be employed that includes, at the organization-defined level of detail, one or more of the following:
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.a}} - security-relevant external system interfaces;
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.b}} - high-level design;
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.c}} - low-level design;
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.d}} - source code;
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.e}} - hardware schematics; and/or
      • objective: {{sa-4.2_obj.3.f}} - organization-defined design/implementation information.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-5, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-4.2_prm_1, How Many: one or moresecurity-relevant external system interfaces, high-level design, low-level design, source code or hardware schematics, {{ sa-4.2_prm_2 }} ,
{{sa-4.2_prm_2}}: organization-defined design/implementation information
{{sa-4.2_prm_3}}: organization-defined level of detail
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for determining level of detail for system design and security controls organizational processes for developing acquisition contracts automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing development of system design details

securityControls.title: sa-4.3 - Development Methods / Techniques / Practices
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to demonstrate the use of a system development life cycle that includes {{ sa-4.3_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-4.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.1}} - defines state-of-the-practice system/security engineering methods to be included in the system development life cycle employed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.2}} - defines software development methods to be included in the system development life cycle employed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.3}} - defines testing/evaluation/validation techniques to be included in the system development life cycle employed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.4}} - defines quality control processes to be included in the system development life cycle employed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.5}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to demonstrate the use of a system development life cycle that includes:
      • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.5.a}} - organization-defined state-of-the-practice system/security engineering methods;
      • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.5.b}} - organization-defined software development methods;
      • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.5.c}} - organization-defined testing/evaluation/validation techniques; and
      • objective: {{sa-4.3_obj.5.d}} - organization-defined quality control processes.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-12, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined state-of-the-practice system/security engineering methods, software development methods, testing/evaluation/validation techniques, and quality control processes
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for development methods, techniques, and processes

securityControls.title: sa-4.4 - Assignment of Components to Systems
sa-4.5 - System / Component / Service Configurations
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-4.5_smt.a}} - Deliver the system, component, or service with {{ sa-4.5_prm_1 }} implemented; and
    • item: {{sa-4.5_smt.b}} - Use the configurations as the default for any subsequent system, component, or service reinstallation or upgrade.
  • ID: {{sa-4.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.5.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-4.5.a_obj.1}} - defines security configurations to be implemented by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
      • objective: {{sa-4.5.a_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to deliver the system, component, or service with organization-defined security configurations implemented; and
    • objective: {{sa-4.5.b_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to use the configurations as the default for any subsequent system, component, or service reinstallation or upgrade.


  • Guidance
    • #cm-8, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined security configurations
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms used to verify that the configuration of the information system, component, or service, as delivered, is as specified

securityControls.title: sa-4.6 - Use of Information Assurance Products
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.6_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-4.6_smt.a}} - Employs only government off-the-shelf (GOTS) or commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) information assurance (IA) and IA-enabled information technology products that compose an NSA-approved solution to protect classified information when the networks used to transmit the information are at a lower classification level than the information being transmitted; and
    • item: {{sa-4.6_smt.b}} - Ensures that these products have been evaluated and/or validated by NSA or in accordance with NSA-approved procedures.
  • ID: {{sa-4.6_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.6.a_obj}} - employs only government off-the-shelf (GOTS) or commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) information assurance (IA) and IA-enabled information technology products that compose an NSA-approved solution to protect classified information when the networks used to transmit the information are at a lower classification level than the information being transmitted; and
    • objective: {{sa-4.6.b_obj}} - ensures that these products have been evaluated and/or validated by the NSA or in accordance with NSA-approved procedures.


  • Guidance
    • #sc-8, related
    • #sc-12, related
    • #sc-13, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for selecting and employing evaluated and/or validated information assurance products and services that compose an NSA-approved solution to protect classified information

securityControls.title: sa-4.7 - Niap-approved Protection Profiles
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-4.7_smt.a}} - Limits the use of commercially provided information assurance (IA) and IA-enabled information technology products to those products that have been successfully evaluated against a National Information Assurance partnership (NIAP)-approved Protection Profile for a specific technology type, if such a profile exists; and
    • item: {{sa-4.7_smt.b}} - Requires, if no NIAP-approved Protection Profile exists for a specific technology type but a commercially provided information technology product relies on cryptographic functionality to enforce its security policy, that the cryptographic module is FIPS-validated.
  • ID: {{sa-4.7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.7.a_obj}} - limits the use of commercially-provided information assurance (IA) and IA-enabled information technology products to those products that have been successfully evaluated against a National Information Assurance partnership (NIAP)-approved Protection Profile for a specific technology type, if such a profile exists; and
    • objective: {{sa-4.7.b_obj}} - requires, if no NIAP-approved Protection Profile exists for a specific technology type but a commercially provided information technology product relies on cryptographic functionality to enforce its security policy, that the cryptographic module is FIPS-validated.


  • Guidance
    • #sc-12, related
    • #sc-13, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for selecting and employing products/services evaluated against a NIAP-approved protection profile or FIPS-validated products

securityControls.title: sa-4.8 - Continuous Monitoring Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce a plan for the continuous monitoring of security control effectiveness that contains {{ sa-4.8_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-4.8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-4.8_obj.1}} - defines the level of detail the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service is required to provide when producing a plan for the continuous monitoring of security control effectiveness; and
    • objective: {{sa-4.8_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce a plan for the continuous monitoring of security control effectiveness that contains the organization-defined level of detail.


  • Guidance
    • #ca-7, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.8_prm_1}}: organization-defined level of detail
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Vendor processes for continuous monitoring automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing developer continuous monitoring

securityControls.title: sa-4.9 - Functions / Ports / Protocols / Services in Use
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to identify early in the system development life cycle, the functions, ports, protocols, and services intended for organizational use.
  • ID: {{sa-4.9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to identify early in the system development life cycle:
    • objective: {{sa-4.9_obj.1}} - the functions intended for organizational use;
    • objective: {{sa-4.9_obj.2}} - the ports intended for organizational use;
    • objective: {{sa-4.9_obj.3}} - the protocols intended for organizational use; and
    • objective: {{sa-4.9_obj.4}} - the services intended for organizational use.


  • Guidance
    • #cm-7, related
    • #sa-9, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: INTERVIEW
      • Organizational personnel with acquisition/contracting responsibilities organizational personnel with responsibility for determining information system security requirements system/network administrators organizational personnel operating, using, and/or maintaining the information system information system developers organizational personnel with information security responsibilities

securityControls.title: sa-4.10 - Use of Approved PIV Products
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.10_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs only information technology products on the FIPS 201-approved products list for Personal Identity Verification (PIV) capability implemented within organizational information systems.
  • ID: {{sa-4.10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization employs only information technology products on the FIPS 201-approved products list for Personal Identity Verification (PIV) capability implemented within organizational information systems.


  • Guidance
    • #ia-2, related
    • #ia-8, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for selecting and employing FIPS 201-approved products

securityControls.title: sa-5 - Information System Documentation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.a}} - Obtains administrator documentation for the information system, system component, or information system service that describes:
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.1}} - Secure configuration, installation, and operation of the system, component, or service;
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.2}} - Effective use and maintenance of security functions/mechanisms; and
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.3}} - Known vulnerabilities regarding configuration and use of administrative (i.e., privileged) functions;
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.b}} - Obtains user documentation for the information system, system component, or information system service that describes:
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.1}} - User-accessible security functions/mechanisms and how to effectively use those security functions/mechanisms;
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.2}} - Methods for user interaction, which enables individuals to use the system, component, or service in a more secure manner; and
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.3}} - User responsibilities in maintaining the security of the system, component, or service;
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.c}} - Documents attempts to obtain information system, system component, or information system service documentation when such documentation is either unavailable or nonexistent and takes {{ sa-5_prm_1 }} in response;
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.d}} - Protects documentation as required, in accordance with the risk management strategy; and
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.e}} - Distributes documentation to {{ sa-5_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-5.a_obj}} - obtains administrator documentation for the information system, system component, or information system service that describes:
      • objective: {{sa-5.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-5.a.1_obj.1}} - secure configuration of the system, system component, or service;
        • objective: {{sa-5.a.1_obj.2}} - secure installation of the system, system component, or service;
        • objective: {{sa-5.a.1_obj.3}} - secure operation of the system, system component, or service;
      • objective: {{sa-5.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-5.a.2_obj.1}} - effective use of the security features/mechanisms;
        • objective: {{sa-5.a.2_obj.2}} - effective maintenance of the security features/mechanisms;
      • objective: {{sa-5.a.3_obj}} - known vulnerabilities regarding configuration and use of administrative (i.e., privileged) functions;
    • objective: {{sa-5.b_obj}} - obtains user documentation for the information system, system component, or information system service that describes:
      • objective: {{sa-5.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-5.b.1_obj.1}} - user-accessible security functions/mechanisms;
        • objective: {{sa-5.b.1_obj.2}} - how to effectively use those functions/mechanisms;
      • objective: {{sa-5.b.2_obj}} - methods for user interaction, which enables individuals to use the system, component, or service in a more secure manner;
      • objective: {{sa-5.b.3_obj}} - user responsibilities in maintaining the security of the system, component, or service;
    • objective: {{sa-5.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-5.c_obj.1}} - defines actions to be taken after documented attempts to obtain information system, system component, or information system service documentation when such documentation is either unavailable or nonexistent;
      • objective: {{sa-5.c_obj.2}} - documents attempts to obtain information system, system component, or information system service documentation when such documentation is either unavailable or nonexistent;
      • objective: {{sa-5.c_obj.3}} - takes organization-defined actions in response;
    • objective: {{sa-5.d_obj}} - protects documentation as required, in accordance with the risk management strategy;
    • objective: {{sa-5.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-5.e_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to whom documentation is to be distributed; and
      • objective: {{sa-5.e_obj.2}} - distributes documentation to organization-defined personnel or roles.


  • Guidance
    • #cm-6, related
    • #cm-8, related
    • #pl-2, related
    • #pl-4, related
    • #ps-2, related
    • #sa-3, related
    • #sa-4, related

sa-8 - Security Engineering Principles
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization applies information system security engineering principles in the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of the information system.
  • ID: {{sa-8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization applies information system security engineering principles in:
    • objective: {{sa-8_obj.1}} - the specification of the information system;
    • objective: {{sa-8_obj.2}} - the design of the information system;
    • objective: {{sa-8_obj.3}} - the development of the information system;

securityControls.title: sa-9 - External Information System Services
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-9_smt.a}} - Requires that providers of external information system services comply with organizational information security requirements and employ {{ sa-9_prm_1 }} in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance;
    • item: {{sa-9_smt.b}} - Defines and documents government oversight and user roles and responsibilities with regard to external information system services; and
    • item: {{sa-9_smt.c}} - Employs {{ sa-9_prm_2 }} to monitor security control compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis.
  • ID: {{sa-9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-9.a_obj.1}} - defines security controls to be employed by providers of external information system services;
      • objective: {{sa-9.a_obj.2}} - requires that providers of external information system services comply with organizational information security requirements;
      • objective: {{sa-9.a_obj.3}} - requires that providers of external information system services employ organization-defined security controls in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance;
    • objective: {{sa-9.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-9.b_obj.1}} - defines and documents government oversight with regard to external information system services;
      • objective: {{sa-9.b_obj.2}} - defines and documents user roles and responsibilities with regard to external information system services;
    • objective: {{sa-9.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-9.c_obj.1}} - defines processes, methods, and techniques to be employed to monitor security control compliance by external service providers; and
      • objective: {{sa-9.c_obj.2}} - employs organization-defined processes, methods, and techniques to monitor security control compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis.


  • Guidance
    • #ca-3, related
    • #ir-7, related
    • #ps-7, related

securityControls.title: sa-9.1 - Risk Assessments / Organizational Approvals
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-9.1_smt.a}} - Conducts an organizational assessment of risk prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services; and
    • item: {{sa-9.1_smt.b}} - Ensures that the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services is approved by {{ sa-9.1_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-9.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.1.a_obj}} - conducts an organizational assessment of risk prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services;
    • objective: {{sa-9.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-9.1.b_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles designated to approve the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services; and
      • objective: {{sa-9.1.b_obj.2}} - ensures that the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services is approved by organization-defined personnel or roles.


  • Guidance
    • #ca-6, related
    • #ra-3, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-9.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined personnel or roles

    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for conducting a risk assessment prior to acquiring or outsourcing dedicated information security services organizational processes for approving the outsourcing of dedicated information security services automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing risk assessment automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing approval processes

securityControls.title: sa-9.2 - Identification of Functions / Ports / Protocols / Services
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires providers of {{ sa-9.2_prm_1 }} to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and other services required for the use of such services.
  • ID: {{sa-9.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.1}} - defines external information system services for which providers of such services are to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and other services required for the use of such services;
    • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.2}} - requires providers of organization-defined external information system services to identify:
      • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.2.a}} - the functions required for the use of such services;
      • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.2.b}} - the ports required for the use of such services;
      • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.2.c}} - the protocols required for the use of such services; and
      • objective: {{sa-9.2_obj.2.d}} - the other services required for the use of such services.

    • #cm-7, related

securityControls.title: sa-9.3 - Establish / Maintain Trust Relationship with Providers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes, documents, and maintains trust relationships with external service providers based on {{ sa-9.3_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-9.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.3_obj.1}} - defines requirements, properties, factors, or conditions defining acceptable trust relationships;
    • objective: {{sa-9.3_obj.2}} - based on organization-defined requirements, properties, factors, or conditions defining acceptable trust relationships:
      • objective: {{sa-9.3_obj.2.a}} - establishes trust relationships with external service providers;
      • objective: {{sa-9.3_obj.2.b}} - documents trust relationships with external service providers; and
      • objective: {{sa-9.3_obj.2.c}} - maintains trust relationships with external service providers.

securityControls.title: sa-9.4 - Consistent Interests of Consumers and Providers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-9.4_prm_1 }} to ensure that the interests of {{ sa-9.4_prm_2 }} are consistent with and reflect organizational interests.
  • ID: {{sa-9.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.4_obj.1}} - defines external service providers whose interests are to be consistent with and reflect organizational interests;
    • objective: {{sa-9.4_obj.2}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to ensure that the interests of organization-defined external service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests; and
    • objective: {{sa-9.4_obj.3}} - employs organization-defined security safeguards to ensure that the interests of organization-defined external service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests.


  • Guidance

{{sa-9.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined security safeguards

securityControls.title: sa-9.5 - Processing, Storage, and Service Location
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization restricts the location of {{ sa-9.5_prm_1 }} to {{ sa-9.5_prm_2 }} based on {{ sa-9.5_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-9.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.1}} - defines locations where organization-defined information processing, information/data, and/or information system services are to be restricted;
    • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.2}} - defines requirements or conditions to restrict the location of information processing, information/data, and/or information system services;
    • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.3}} - restricts the location of one or more of the following to organization-defined locations based on organization-defined requirements or conditions:
      • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.3.a}} - information processing;
      • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.3.b}} - information/data; and/or
      • objective: {{sa-9.5_obj.3.c}} - information services.


  • Guidance

{{sa-9.5_prm_2}}: organization-defined locations

securityControls.title: sa-10 - Developer Configuration Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.a}} - Perform configuration management during system, component, or service {{ sa-10_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.b}} - Document, manage, and control the integrity of changes to {{ sa-10_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.c}} - Implement only organization-approved changes to the system, component, or service;
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.d}} - Document approved changes to the system, component, or service and the potential security impacts of such changes; and
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.e}} - Track security flaws and flaw resolution within the system, component, or service and report findings to {{ sa-10_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-10.a_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to perform configuration management during one or more of the following:
      • objective: {{sa-10.a_obj.1}} - system, component, or service design;
      • objective: {{sa-10.a_obj.2}} - system, component, or service development;
      • objective: {{sa-10.a_obj.3}} - system, component, or service implementation; and/or
      • objective: {{sa-10.a_obj.4}} - system, component, or service operation;
    • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj.1}} - defines configuration items to be placed under configuration management;
      • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
        • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj.2.a}} - document the integrity of changes to organization-defined items under configuration management;
        • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj.2.b}} - manage the integrity of changes to organization-defined items under configuration management;
        • objective: {{sa-10.b_obj.2.c}} - control the integrity of changes to organization-defined items under configuration management;
    • objective: {{sa-10.c_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to implement only organization-approved changes to the system, component, or service;
    • objective: {{sa-10.d_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to document:
      • objective: {{sa-10.d_obj.1}} - approved changes to the system, component, or service;
      • objective: {{sa-10.d_obj.2}} - the potential security impacts of such changes;
    • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj.1}} - defines personnel to whom findings, resulting from security flaws and flaw resolution tracked within the system, component, or service, are to be reported;
      • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
        • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj.2.a}} - track security flaws within the system, component, or service;
        • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj.2.b}} - track security flaw resolution within the system, component, or service; and
        • objective: {{sa-10.e_obj.2.c}} - report findings to organization-defined personnel.


  • Guidance

    • #cm-9, related

    • #si-2, related

securityControls.title: sa-10.4 - Trusted Generation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to employ tools for comparing newly generated versions of security-relevant hardware descriptions and software/firmware source and object code with previous versions.
  • ID: {{sa-10.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to employ tools for comparing newly generated versions of:
    • objective: {{sa-10.4_obj.1}} - security-relevant hardware descriptions with previous versions; and

  • ID: {{sa-10.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to maintain the integrity of the mapping between the master build data (hardware drawings and software/firmware code) describing the current version of security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware and the on-site master copy of the data for the current version.

securityControls.title: sa-11 - Developer Security Testing and Evaluation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.a}} - Create and implement a security assessment plan;
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.b}} - Perform {{ sa-11_prm_1 }} testing/evaluation at {{ sa-11_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.c}} - Produce evidence of the execution of the security assessment plan and the results of the security testing/evaluation;
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.d}} - Implement a verifiable flaw remediation process; and
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.e}} - Correct flaws identified during security testing/evaluation.
  • ID: {{sa-11_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-11.a_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to create and implement a security plan;
    • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.1}} - defines the depth of testing/evaluation to be performed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
      • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.2}} - defines the coverage of testing/evaluation to be performed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
      • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.3}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to perform one or more of the following testing/evaluation at the organization-defined depth and coverage:
        • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.3.a}} - unit testing/evaluation;
        • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.3.b}} - integration testing/evaluation;
        • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.3.c}} - system testing/evaluation; and/or
        • objective: {{sa-11.b_obj.3.d}} - regression testing/evaluation;
    • objective: {{sa-11.c_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce evidence of:
      • objective: {{sa-11.c_obj.1}} - the execution of the security assessment plan;
      • objective: {{sa-11.c_obj.2}} - the results of the security testing/evaluation;
    • objective: {{sa-11.d_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to implement a verifiable flaw remediation process; and
    • objective: {{sa-11.e_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to correct flaws identified during security testing/evaluation.


  • Guidance

    • #cm-4, related
    • #sa-3, related
    • #sa-4, related
    • #sa-5, related
    • #si-2, related

securityControls.title: sa-11.3 - Independent Verification of Assessment Plans / Evidence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-11.3_smt.a}} - Requires an independent agent satisfying {{ sa-11.3_prm_1 }} to verify the correct implementation of the developer security assessment plan and the evidence produced during security testing/evaluation; and
    • item: {{sa-11.3_smt.b}} - Ensures that the independent agent is either provided with sufficient information to complete the verification process or granted the authority to obtain such information.
  • ID: {{sa-11.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-11.3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-11.3.a_obj.1}} - defines independence criteria that an independent agent is required to satisfy;
      • objective: {{sa-11.3.a_obj.2}} - requires an independent agent satisfying organization-defined independence criteria to verify:
        • objective: {{sa-11.3.a_obj.2.a}} - the correct implementation of the developer security assessment plan;
        • objective: {{sa-11.3.a_obj.2.b}} - the evidence produced during security testing/evaluation;
    • objective: {{sa-11.3.b_obj}} - ensures that the independent agent is either:
      • objective: {{sa-11.3.b_obj.1}} - provided with sufficient information to complete the verification process; or
      • objective: {{sa-11.3.b_obj.2}} - granted the authority to obtain such information.

securityControls.title: sa-12 - Supply Chain Protection
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization protects against supply chain threats to the information system, system component, or information system service by employing {{ sa-12_prm_1 }} as part of a comprehensive, defense-in-breadth information security strategy.

securityControls.title: sa-12.2 - Supplier Reviews
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization conducts a supplier review prior to entering into a contractual agreement to acquire the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization conducts a supplier review prior to entering into a contractual agreement to acquire the information system, system component, or information system service.


  • Guidance
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for conducting supplier reviews automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing supplier reviews

sa-12.4 - Diversity of Suppliers
sa-12.5 - Limitation of Harm
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.5_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-12.5_prm_1 }} to limit harm from potential adversaries identifying and targeting the organizational supply chain.
  • ID: {{sa-12.5_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.5_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to limit harm from potential adversaries identifying and targeting the organizational supply chain; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.5_obj.2}} - employs organization-defined security safeguards to limit harm from potential adversaries identifying and targeting the organizational supply chain.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-12.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined security safeguards
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for defining and employing safeguards to limit harm from adversaries of the organizational supply chain automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing the definition and employment of safeguards to protect the organizational supply chain

securityControls.title: sa-12.6 - Minimizing Procurement Time
sa-12.7 - Assessments Prior to Selection / Acceptance / Update
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization conducts an assessment of the information system, system component, or information system service prior to selection, acceptance, or update.

    • objective: {{sa-12.7_obj.1}} - selection;
    • objective: {{sa-12.7_obj.2}} - acceptance; or

securityControls.title: sa-12.8 - Use of All-source Intelligence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.8_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization uses all-source intelligence analysis of suppliers and potential suppliers of the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization uses all-source intelligence analysis of:
    • objective: {{sa-12.8_obj.1}} - suppliers of the information system, system component, or information system service; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.8_obj.2}} - potential suppliers of the information system, system component, or information system service.

securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST

securityControls.title: sa-12.9 - Operations Security
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-12.9_prm_1 }} in accordance with classification guides to protect supply chain-related information for the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.9_obj.1}} - defines Operations Security (OPSEC) safeguards to be employed in accordance with classification guides to protect supply chain-related information for the information system, system component, or information system service; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.9_obj.2}} - employs organization-defined OPSEC safeguards in accordance with classification guides to protect supply chain-related information for the information system, system component, or information system service.

Parameters

securityControls.title: sa-12.10 - Validate as Genuine and Not Altered
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.10_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-12.10_prm_1 }} to validate that the information system or system component received is genuine and has not been altered.
  • ID: {{sa-12.10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.10_obj.1}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to validate that the information system or system component received is genuine and has not been altered; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.10_obj.2}} - employs organization-defined security safeguards to validate that the information system or system components received is genuine and has not been altered.

securityControls.title: sa-12.11 - Penetration Testing / Analysis of Elements, Processes, and Actors
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.11_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-12.11_prm_1 }} of {{ sa-12.11_prm_2 }} associated with the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.11_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.1}} - defines supply chain:
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.1.a}} - elements to be analyzed and/or tested;
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.1.b}} - processes to be analyzed and/or tested;
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.1.c}} - actors to be analyzed and/or tested;
    • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.2}} - employs one or more of the following to analyze and/or test organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and actors associated with the information system, system component, or information system service:
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.2.a}} - organizational analysis;
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.2.b}} - independent third party analysis;
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.2.c}} - organizational penetration testing; and/or
      • objective: {{sa-12.11_obj.2.d}} - independent third-party penetration testing.


  • Guidance
    • #ra-5, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-12.11_prm_1, How Many: one or moreorganizational analysis, independent third-party analysis, organizational penetration testing, independent third-party penetration testing,
{{sa-12.11_prm_2}}: organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and actors
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for defining and employing methods of analysis/testing of supply chain elements, processes, and actors automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing the analysis/testing of supply chain elements, processes, and actors

securityControls.title: sa-12.12 - Inter-organizational Agreements
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.12_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes inter-organizational agreements and procedures with entities involved in the supply chain for the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.12_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization establishes, with entities involved in the supply chain for the information system, system component, or information system service,:
    • objective: {{sa-12.12_obj.1}} - inter-organizational agreements; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.12_obj.2}} - inter-organizational procedures.


  • Guidance
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST

securityControls.title: sa-12.13 - Critical Information System Components
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.13_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization employs {{ sa-12.13_prm_1 }} to ensure an adequate supply of {{ sa-12.13_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-12.13_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.13_obj.1}} - defines critical information system components for which security safeguards are to be employed to ensure an adequate supply of such components;
    • objective: {{sa-12.13_obj.2}} - defines security safeguards to be employed to ensure an adequate supply of organization-defined critical information components; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.13_obj.3}} - employs organization-defined security safeguards to ensure an adequate supply of organization-defined critical information system components.

{{sa-12.13_prm_1}}: organization-defined security safeguards
{{sa-12.13_prm_2}}: organization-defined critical information system components

securityControls.title: sa-12.14 - Identity and Traceability
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.14_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes and retains unique identification of {{ sa-12.14_prm_1 }} for the information system, system component, or information system service.
  • ID: {{sa-12.14_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-12.14_obj.1}} - defines the following for the establishment and retention of unique identification:
      • objective: {{sa-12.14_obj.1.a}} - supply chain elements;
      • objective: {{sa-12.14_obj.1.b}} - supply chain processes;
      • objective: {{sa-12.14_obj.1.c}} - supply chain actors; and
    • objective: {{sa-12.14_obj.2}} - establishes and retains unique identification of organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and actors for the information system, system component, or information system service.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-12.14_prm_1}}: organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and actors
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for defining, establishing, and retaining unique identification for supply chain elements, processes, and actors automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing the definition, establishment, and retention of unique identification for supply chain elements, processes, and actors

securityControls.title: sa-12.15 - Processes to Address Weaknesses or Deficiencies
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-12.15_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization establishes a process to address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements.
  • ID: {{sa-12.15_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization establishes a process to address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements.


  • Guidance
securityControls.assessmentPlan:

securityControls.title: sa-13 - Trustworthiness
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-13_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-13_smt.a}} - Describes the trustworthiness required in the {{ sa-13_prm_1 }} supporting its critical missions/business functions; and
    • item: {{sa-13_smt.b}} - Implements {{ sa-13_prm_2 }} to achieve such trustworthiness.
  • ID: {{sa-13_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-13.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-13.a_obj.1}} - defines information system, system component, or information system service for which the trustworthiness required is to be described;
      • objective: {{sa-13.a_obj.2}} - describes the trustworthiness required in organization-defined information system, information system component, or information system service supporting its critical mission/business functions;
    • objective: {{sa-13.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-13.b_obj.1}} - defines an assurance overlay to be implemented to achieve such trustworthiness; and
      • objective: {{sa-13.b_obj.2}} - organization implements the organization-defined assurance overlay to achieve such trustworthiness.

securityControls.title: sa-14 - Criticality Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-14_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization identifies critical information system components and functions by performing a criticality analysis for {{ sa-14_prm_1 }} at {{ sa-14_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-14_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-14_obj.1}} - defines information systems, information system components, or information system services requiring a criticality analysis to identify critical information system components and functions;
    • objective: {{sa-14_obj.2}} - defines decision points in the system development life cycle when a criticality analysis is to be performed for organization-defined information systems, information system components, or information system services; and
    • objective: {{sa-14_obj.3}} - identifies critical information system components and functions by performing a criticality analysis for organization-defined information systems, information system components, or information system services at organization-defined decisions points in the system development life cycle.

securityControls.title: sa-14.1 - Critical Components with No Viable Alternative Sourcing
sa-15 - Development Process, Standards, and Tools
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sa-15_smt.a}} - Requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to follow a documented development process that:
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.1}} - Explicitly addresses security requirements;
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.2}} - Identifies the standards and tools used in the development process;
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.3}} - Documents the specific tool options and tool configurations used in the development process; and
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.4}} - Documents, manages, and ensures the integrity of changes to the process and/or tools used in development; and
    • item: {{sa-15_smt.b}} - Reviews the development process, standards, tools, and tool options/configurations {{ sa-15_prm_1 }} to determine if the process, standards, tools, and tool options/configurations selected and employed can satisfy {{ sa-15_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-15_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-15.a_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to follow a documented development process that:
      • objective: {{sa-15.a.1_obj}} - explicitly addresses security requirements;
      • objective: {{sa-15.a.2_obj}} - identifies the standards and tools used in the development process;
      • objective: {{sa-15.a.3_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-15.a.3_obj.1}} - documents the specific tool options used in the development process;
        • objective: {{sa-15.a.3_obj.2}} - documents the specific tool configurations used in the development process;
      • objective: {{sa-15.a.4_obj}}
        • objective: {{sa-15.a.4_obj.1}} - documents changes to the process and/or tools used in the development;
        • objective: {{sa-15.a.4_obj.2}} - manages changes to the process and/or tools used in the development;
        • objective: {{sa-15.a.4_obj.3}} - ensures the integrity of changes to the process and/or tools used in the development;
    • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.1}} - defines a frequency to review the development process, standards, tools, and tool options/configurations;
      • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.2}} - defines security requirements to be satisfied by the process, standards, tools, and tool option/configurations selected and employed; and
      • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.3}}
        • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.3.a}} - reviews the development process with the organization-defined frequency to determine if the process selected and employed can satisfy organization-defined security requirements;
        • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.3.b}} - reviews the development standards with the organization-defined frequency to determine if the standards selected and employed can satisfy organization-defined security requirements;
        • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.3.c}} - reviews the development tools with the organization-defined frequency to determine if the tools selected and employed can satisfy organization-defined security requirements; and
        • objective: {{sa-15.b_obj.3.d}} - reviews the development tool options/configurations with the organization-defined frequency to determine if the tool options/configurations selected and employed can satisfy organization-defined security requirements.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-3, related
    • #sa-8, related

securityControls.title: sa-15.1 - Quality Metrics
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-15.1_smt.a}} - Define quality metrics at the beginning of the development process; and
    • item: {{sa-15.1_smt.b}} - Provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics {{ sa-15.1_prm_1 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-15.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-15.1.a_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to define quality metrics at the beginning of the development process;
    • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.1}} - defines a frequency to provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics;
      • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.2}} - defines program review milestones to provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics;
      • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.3}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics one or more of the following:
        • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.3.a}} - with the organization-defined frequency;
        • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.3.b}} - in accordance with the organization-defined program review milestones; and/or
        • objective: {{sa-15.1.b_obj.3.c}} - upon delivery of the information system, system component, or information system service.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-15.1_prm_1, How Many: one or more {{ sa-15.1_prm_2 }} , {{ sa-15.1_prm_3 }} , upon delivery,
{{sa-15.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined frequency
{{sa-15.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined program review milestones
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: INTERVIEW
      • Organizational personnel with system and services acquisition responsibilities organizational personnel with information security responsibilities system developer

securityControls.title: sa-15.2 - Security Tracking Tools
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to select and employ a security tracking tool for use during the development process.
  • ID: {{sa-15.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to select and employ a security tracking tool for use during the development process.

• Assessment

securityControls.title: sa-15.3 - Criticality Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to perform a criticality analysis at {{ sa-15.3_prm_1 }} and at {{ sa-15.3_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-15.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-15.3_obj.1}} - defines the breadth of criticality analysis to be performed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-15.3_obj.2}} - defines the depth of criticality analysis to be performed by the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service;
    • objective: {{sa-15.3_obj.3}} - defines decision points in the system development life cycle when a criticality analysis is to be performed for the information system, system component, or information system service; and
    • objective: {{sa-15.3_obj.4}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to perform a criticality analysis at the organization-defined breadth/depth and at organization-defined decision points in the system development life cycle.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-4, related
    • #sa-14, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-15.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined breadth/depth
{{sa-15.3_prm_2}}: organization-defined decision points in the system development life cycle

• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST

securityControls.title: sa-15.4 - Threat Modeling / Vulnerability Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires that developers perform threat modeling and a vulnerability analysis for the information system at {{ sa-15.4_prm_1 }} that:
    • item: {{sa-15.4_smt.a}} - Uses {{ sa-15.4_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-15.4_smt.b}} - Employs {{ sa-15.4_prm_3 }}; and
    • item: {{sa-15.4_smt.c}} - Produces evidence that meets {{ sa-15.4_prm_4 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-15.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.1}} - defines the breadth of threat modeling and vulnerability analysis to be performed by developers for the information system;
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.2}} - defines the depth of threat modeling and vulnerability analysis to be performed by developers for the information system;
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.3}} - defines information concerning impact, environment of operations, known or assumed threats, and acceptable risk levels to be used in threat modeling and vulnerability analysis;
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.4}} - defines tools and methods to be employed in threat modeling and vulnerability analysis;
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.5}} - defines acceptance criteria for evidence produced from threat modeling and vulnerability analysis;
    • objective: {{sa-15.4_obj.6}} - requires that developers perform threat modeling and a vulnerability analysis for the information system at the organization-defined breadth/depth that:
      • objective: {{sa-15.4.a_obj.6}} - uses organization-defined information concerning impact, environment of operations, known or assumed threats, and acceptable risk levels;
      • objective: {{sa-15.4.b_obj.6}} - employs organization-defined tools and methods; and
      • objective: {{sa-15.4.c_obj.6}} - produces evidence that meets organization-defined acceptance criteria.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-4, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-15.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined breadth/depth
{{sa-15.4_prm_2}}: organization-defined information concerning impact, environment of operations, known or assumed threats, and acceptable risk levels
{{sa-15.4_prm_3}}: organization-defined tools and methods
{{sa-15.4_prm_4}}: organization-defined acceptance criteria
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for performing development threat modeling and vulnerability analysis automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing development threat modeling and vulnerability analysis

securityControls.title: sa-15.5 - Attack Surface Reduction
securityControls.description:

securityControls.title: sa-15.7 - Automated Vulnerability Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.7_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.a}} - Perform an automated vulnerability analysis using {{ sa-15.7_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.b}} - Determine the exploitation potential for discovered vulnerabilities;
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.c}} - Determine potential risk mitigations for delivered vulnerabilities; and
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.d}} - Deliver the outputs of the tools and results of the analysis to {{ sa-15.7_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{sa-15.7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-15.7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-15.7.a_obj.1}} - defines tools to be used to perform automated vulnerability analysis of the information system, system component, or information system service;
      • objective: {{sa-15.7.a_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to perform an automated vulnerability analysis using organization-defined tools;
    • objective: {{sa-15.7.b_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to determine the exploitation potential for discovered vulnerabilities;
    • objective: {{sa-15.7.c_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to determine potential risk mitigations for delivered vulnerabilities;
    • objective: {{sa-15.7.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-15.7.d_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the output of the tools and results of the analysis are to be delivered; and
      • objective: {{sa-15.7.d_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to deliver the outputs of the tools and results of the analysis to organization-defined personnel or roles.


  • Guidance
    • #ra-5, related

securityControls.title: sa-17 - Developer Security Architecture and Design

    • item: {{sa-17_smt.b}} - Accurately and completely describes the required security functionality, and the allocation of security controls among physical and logical components; and
    • item: {{sa-17_smt.c}} - Expresses how individual security functions, mechanisms, and services work together to provide required security capabilities and a unified approach to protection.
  • ID: {{sa-17_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce a design specification and security architecture that:
    • objective: {{sa-17.a_obj}} - is consistent with and supportive of the organization’s security architecture which is established within and is an integrated part of the organization’s enterprise architecture;
    • objective: {{sa-17.b_obj}} - accurately and completely describes:
      • objective: {{sa-17.b_obj.1}} - the required security functionality;
      • objective: {{sa-17.b_obj.2}} - the allocation of security controls among physical and logical components; and

securityControls.title: sa-17.1 - Formal Policy Model
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.1_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal policy model describing the {{ sa-17.1_prm_1 }} to be enforced; and
    • item: {{sa-17.1_smt.b}} - Prove that the formal policy model is internally consistent and sufficient to enforce the defined elements of the organizational security policy when implemented.
  • ID: {{sa-17.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sa-17.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sa-17.1.a_obj.1}} - defines elements of the organizational security policy to be enforced under a formal policy model produced by the developer as an integral part of the development process for the information system, system component, or information system service;
      • objective: {{sa-17.1.a_obj.2}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal policy model describing the organization-defined elements of organizational security policy to be enforced; and
    • objective: {{sa-17.1.b_obj}} - requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to prove that the formal policy model is internally consistent and sufficient to enforce the defined elements of the organizational security policy when implemented.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:

{{sa-17.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined elements of organizational security policy

securityControls.title: sa-17.3 - Formal Correspondence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of exceptions, error messages, and effects;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.b}} - Show via proof to the extent feasible with additional informal demonstration as necessary, that the formal top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.c}} - Show via informal demonstration, that the formal top-level specification completely covers the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.d}} - Show that the formal top-level specification is an accurate description of the implemented security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.e}} - Describe the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware mechanisms not addressed in the formal top-level specification but strictly internal to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware.
  • ID: {{sa-17.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • objective: {{sa-17.3.a_obj}} - produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of:
      • objective: {{sa-17.3.a_obj.1}} - exceptions;
      • objective: {{sa-17.3.a_obj.2}} - error messages;
      • objective: {{sa-17.3.a_obj.3}} - effects;
    • objective: {{sa-17.3.b_obj}} - show via proof to the extent feasible with additional informal demonstration as necessary, that the formal top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;
    • objective: {{sa-17.3.c_obj}} - show via informal demonstration, that the formal top-level specification completely covers the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware;
    • objective: {{sa-17.3.d_obj}} - show that the formal top-level specification is an accurate description of the implemented security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
    • objective: {{sa-17.3.e_obj}} - describe the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware mechanisms not addressed in the formal top-level specification but strictly internal to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware.


  • Guidance
    • #sa-5, related
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment

securityControls.title: sa-17.4 - Informal Correspondence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, an informal descriptive top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of exceptions, error messages, and effects;
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.b}} - Show via {{ sa-17.4_prm_1 }} that the descriptive top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;

    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.e}} - Describe the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware mechanisms not addressed in the descriptive top-level specification but strictly internal to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware.
  • ID: {{sa-17.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to:
    • objective: {{sa-17.4.a_obj}} - produce, as an integral part of the development process, an informal descriptive top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of:
      • objective: {{sa-17.4.a_obj.1}} - exceptions;
      • objective: {{sa-17.4.a_obj.2}} - error messages;
      • objective: {{sa-17.4.a_obj.3}} - effects;
    • objective: {{sa-17.4.b_obj}} - show via informal demonstration and/or convincing argument with formal methods as feasible that the descriptive top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;
    • objective: {{sa-17.4.c_obj}} - show via informal demonstration, that the descriptive top-level specification completely covers the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware;
    • objective: {{sa-17.4.d_obj}} - show that the descriptive top-level specification is an accurate description of the interfaces to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and

securityControls.title: sa-21 - Developer Screening
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-21_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization requires that the developer of {{ sa-21_prm_1 }}:

    • objective: {{sa-21_obj.3}} - defines additional personnel screening criteria to be satisfied by the developer;

      • objective: {{sa-21_obj.4.a}} - requires that the developer of organization-defined information system, system component, or information system service have appropriate access authorizations as determined by assigned organization-defined official government duties; and

securityControls.title: sa-22 - Unsupported System Components

securityControls.title: sc-1 - System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sc-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sc-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ sc-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{sc-1_smt.a.1}} - A system and communications protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{sc-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and communications protection policy and associated system and communications protection controls; and
    • item: {{sc-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{sc-1_smt.b.1}} - System and communications protection policy {{ sc-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{sc-1_smt.b.2}} - System and communications protection procedures {{ sc-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{sc-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{sc-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents a system and communications protection policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the system and communications protection policy is to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the system and communications protection policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{sc-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and communications protection policy and associated system and communications protection controls;
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{sc-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{sc-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{sc-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{sc-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current system and communications protection policy;
        • objective: {{sc-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current system and communications protection policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{sc-1.b.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{sc-1.b.2_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current system and communications protection procedures; and
        • objective: {{sc-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current system and communications protection procedures with the organization-defined frequency.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-9, related

securityControls.title: sc-3.2 - Access / Flow Control Functions

securityControls.title: sc-3.4 - Module Coupling and Cohesiveness

securityControls.title: sc-5 - Denial of Service Protection
securityControls.description:

securityControls.title: sc-7 - Boundary Protection
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sc-7_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{sc-7_smt.a}} - Monitors and controls communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system;
    • item: {{sc-7_smt.b}} - Implements subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are {{ sc-7_prm_1 }} separated from internal organizational networks; and
    • item: {{sc-7_smt.c}} - Connects to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.
  • ID: {{sc-7_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the information system:
    • objective: {{sc-7.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{sc-7.a_obj.1}} - monitors communications at the external boundary of the information system;
      • objective: {{sc-7.a_obj.2}} - monitors communications at key internal boundaries within the system;
      • objective: {{sc-7.a_obj.3}} - controls communications at the external boundary of the information system;
      • objective: {{sc-7.a_obj.4}} - controls communications at key internal boundaries within the system;
    • objective: {{sc-7.b_obj}} - implements subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are either:
      • objective: {{sc-7.b_obj.1}} - physically separated from internal organizational networks; and/or
      • objective: {{sc-7.b_obj.2}} - logically separated from internal organizational networks; and
    • objective: {{sc-7.c_obj}} - connects to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

securityControls.title: sc-7.4 - External Telecommunications Services
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sc-7.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{sc-7.4_smt.a}} - Implements a managed interface for each external telecommunication service;
    • item: {{sc-7.4_smt.b}} - Establishes a traffic flow policy for each managed interface;
    • item: {{sc-7.4_smt.c}} - Protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface;
    • item: {{sc-7.4_smt.d}} - Documents each exception to the traffic flow policy with a supporting mission/business need and duration of that need; and
    • item: {{sc-7.4_smt.e}} - Reviews exceptions to the traffic flow policy {{ sc-7.4_prm_1 }} and removes exceptions that are no longer supported by an explicit mission/business need.

    • objective: {{sc-7.4.b_obj}} - establishes a traffic flow policy for each managed interface;
    • objective: {{sc-7.4.c_obj}} - protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface;
    • objective: {{sc-7.4.d_obj}} - documents each exception to the traffic flow policy with:
      • objective: {{sc-7.4.d_obj.1}} - a supporting mission/business need;
      • objective: {{sc-7.4.d_obj.2}} - duration of that need;
    • objective: {{sc-7.4.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{sc-7.4.e_obj.1}} - defines a frequency to review exceptions to traffic flow policy;
      • objective: {{sc-7.4.e_obj.2}} - reviews exceptions to the traffic flow policy with the organization-defined frequency; and

    • objective: {{si-1.a_obj}}

          • objective: {{si-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{si-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{si-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
