securityControls.title: si-2 - Flaw Remediation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{si-2_smt.a}} - Identifies, reports, and corrects information system flaws;
    • item: {{si-2_smt.b}} - Tests software and firmware updates related to flaw remediation for effectiveness and potential side effects before installation;
    • item: {{si-2_smt.c}} - Installs security-relevant software and firmware updates within {{ si-2_prm_1 }} of the release of the updates; and
    • item: {{si-2_smt.d}} - Incorporates flaw remediation into the organizational configuration management process.
  • ID: {{si-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{si-2.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-2.a_obj.1}} - identifies information system flaws;
      • objective: {{si-2.a_obj.2}} - reports information system flaws;
      • objective: {{si-2.a_obj.3}} - corrects information system flaws;
    • objective: {{si-2.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-2.b_obj.1}} - tests software updates related to flaw remediation for effectiveness and potential side effects before installation;
      • objective: {{si-2.b_obj.2}} - tests firmware updates related to flaw remediation for effectiveness and potential side effects before installation;
    • objective: {{si-2.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-2.c_obj.1}} - defines the time period within which to install security-relevant software updates after the release of the updates;
      • objective: {{si-2.c_obj.2}} - defines the time period within which to install security-relevant firmware updates after the release of the updates;
      • objective: {{si-2.c_obj.3}} - installs software updates within the organization-defined time period of the release of the updates;
      • objective: {{si-2.c_obj.4}} - installs firmware updates within the organization-defined time period of the release of the updates; and
    • objective: {{si-2.d_obj}} - incorporates flaw remediation into the organizational configuration management process.

securityControls.title: si-3 - Malicious Code Protection
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{si-3_smt.a}} - Employs malicious code protection mechanisms at information system entry and exit points to detect and eradicate malicious code;
    • item: {{si-3_smt.b}} - Updates malicious code protection mechanisms whenever new releases are available in accordance with organizational configuration management policy and procedures;
    • item: {{si-3_smt.c}} - Configures malicious code protection mechanisms to:
      • item: {{si-3_smt.c.1}} - Perform periodic scans of the information system {{ si-3_prm_1 }} and real-time scans of files from external sources at {{ si-3_prm_2 }} as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed in accordance with organizational security policy; and
      • item: {{si-3_smt.c.2}} - {{ si-3_prm_3 }} in response to malicious code detection; and
    • item: {{si-3_smt.d}} - Addresses the receipt of false positives during malicious code detection and eradication and the resulting potential impact on the availability of the information system.
  • ID: {{si-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{si-3.a_obj}} - employs malicious code protection mechanisms to detect and eradicate malicious code at information system:
      • objective: {{si-3.a_obj.1}} - entry points;
      • objective: {{si-3.a_obj.2}} - exit points;
    • objective: {{si-3.b_obj}} - updates malicious code protection mechanisms whenever new releases are available in accordance with organizational configuration management policy and procedures (as identified in CM-1);
    • objective: {{si-3.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-3.c_obj.1}} - defines a frequency for malicious code protection mechanisms to perform periodic scans of the information system;
      • objective: {{si-3.c_obj.2}} - defines action to be initiated by malicious protection mechanisms in response to malicious code detection;
      • objective: {{si-3.c_obj.3}}
        • objective: {{si-3.c.1_obj.3}} - configures malicious code protection mechanisms to:
          • objective: {{si-3.c.1_obj.3.a}} - perform periodic scans of the information system with the organization-defined frequency;
          • objective: {{si-3.c.1_obj.3.b}} - perform real-time scans of files from external sources at endpoint and/or network entry/exit points as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed in accordance with organizational security policy;
        • objective: {{si-3.c.2_obj.3}} - configures malicious code protection mechanisms to do one or more of the following:
          • objective: {{si-3.c.2_obj.3.a}} - block malicious code in response to malicious code detection;
          • objective: {{si-3.c.2_obj.3.b}} - quarantine malicious code in response to malicious code detection;
          • objective: {{si-3.c.2_obj.3.c}} - send alert to administrator in response to malicious code detection; and/or
          • objective: {{si-3.c.2_obj.3.d}} - initiate organization-defined action in response to malicious code detection;
    • objective: {{si-3.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-3.d_obj.1}} - addresses the receipt of false positives during malicious code detection and eradication; and
      • objective: {{si-3.d_obj.2}} - addresses the resulting potential impact on the availability of the information system.

securityControls.title: si-3.8 - Detect Unauthorized Commands
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-3.8_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system detects {{ si-3.8_prm_1 }} through the kernel application programming interface at {{ si-3.8_prm_2 }} and {{ si-3.8_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{si-3.8_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.1}} - the organization defines unauthorized operating system commands to be detected by the information system;
    • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.2}} - the organization defines information system hardware components for which organization-defined unauthorized operating system commands are to be detected through the kernel application programming interface;
    • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.3}} - the information system detects organization-defined unauthorized operating system commands through the kernel application programming interface at organization-defined information system hardware components, and does one or more of the following:
      • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.3.a}} - issues a warning;
      • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.3.b}} - audits the command execution; and/or
      • objective: {{si-3.8_obj.3.c}} - prevents the execution of the command.

securityControls.title: si-4 - Information System Monitoring
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{si-4_smt.a}} - Monitors the information system to detect:
      • item: {{si-4_smt.a.1}} - Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with {{ si-4_prm_1 }}; and
      • item: {{si-4_smt.a.2}} - Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.b}} - Identifies unauthorized use of the information system through {{ si-4_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{si-4_smt.c}} - Deploys monitoring devices:
      • item: {{si-4_smt.c.1}} - Strategically within the information system to collect organization-determined essential information; and
      • item: {{si-4_smt.c.2}} - At ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.d}} - Protects information obtained from intrusion-monitoring tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.e}} - Heightens the level of information system monitoring activity whenever there is an indication of increased risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, or the Nation based on law enforcement information, intelligence information, or other credible sources of information;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.f}} - Obtains legal opinion with regard to information system monitoring activities in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, or regulations; and
    • item: {{si-4_smt.g}} - Provides {{ si-4_prm_3 }} to {{ si-4_prm_4 }} {{ si-4_prm_5 }}.
  • ID: {{si-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{si-4.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-4.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{si-4.a.1_obj.1}} - defines monitoring objectives to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks on the information system;
        • objective: {{si-4.a.1_obj.2}} - monitors the information system to detect, in accordance with organization-defined monitoring objectives,:
          • objective: {{si-4.a.1_obj.2.a}} - attacks;
          • objective: {{si-4.a.1_obj.2.b}} - indicators of potential attacks;
      • objective: {{si-4.a.2_obj}} - monitors the information system to detect unauthorized:
        • objective: {{si-4.a.2_obj.1}} - local connections;
        • objective: {{si-4.a.2_obj.2}} - network connections;
        • objective: {{si-4.a.2_obj.3}} - remote connections;
    • objective: {{si-4.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-4.b.1_obj}} - defines techniques and methods to identify unauthorized use of the information system;
      • objective: {{si-4.b.2_obj}} - identifies unauthorized use of the information system through organization-defined techniques and methods;
    • objective: {{si-4.c_obj}} - deploys monitoring devices:
      • objective: {{si-4.c_obj.1}} - strategically within the information system to collect organization-determined essential information;
      • objective: {{si-4.c_obj.2}} - at ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization;
    • objective: {{si-4.d_obj}} - protects information obtained from intrusion-monitoring tools from unauthorized:
      • objective: {{si-4.d_obj.1}} - access;
      • objective: {{si-4.d_obj.2}} - modification;
      • objective: {{si-4.d_obj.3}} - deletion;
    • objective: {{si-4.e_obj}} - heightens the level of information system monitoring activity whenever there is an indication of increased risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, or the Nation based on law enforcement information, intelligence information, or other credible sources of information;
    • objective: {{si-4.f_obj}} - obtains legal opinion with regard to information system monitoring activities in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, or regulations;
    • objective: {{si-4.g_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.1}} - defines personnel or roles to whom information system monitoring information is to be provided;
      • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.2}} - defines information system monitoring information to be provided to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.3}} - defines a frequency to provide organization-defined information system monitoring to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.4}} - provides organization-defined information system monitoring information to organization-defined personnel or roles one or more of the following:
        • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.4.a}} - as needed; and/or
        • objective: {{si-4.g_obj.4.b}} - with the organization-defined frequency.

securityControls.title: si-6 - Security Function Verification
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-6_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system:
    • item: {{si-6_smt.a}} - Verifies the correct operation of {{ si-6_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{si-6_smt.b}} - Performs this verification {{ si-6_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{si-6_smt.c}} - Notifies {{ si-6_prm_5 }} of failed security verification tests; and
    • item: {{si-6_smt.d}} - {{ si-6_prm_6 }} when anomalies are discovered.
  • ID: {{si-6_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{si-6.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-6.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines security functions to be verified for correct operation;
      • objective: {{si-6.a_obj.2}} - the information system verifies the correct operation of organization-defined security functions;
    • objective: {{si-6.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines system transitional states requiring verification of organization-defined security functions;
      • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.2}} - the organization defines a frequency to verify the correct operation of organization-defined security functions;
      • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.3}} - the information system performs this verification one or more of the following:
        • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.3.a}} - at organization-defined system transitional states;
        • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.3.b}} - upon command by user with appropriate privilege; and/or
        • objective: {{si-6.b_obj.3.c}} - with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{si-6.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-6.c_obj.1}} - the organization defines personnel or roles to be notified of failed security verification tests;
      • objective: {{si-6.c_obj.2}} - the information system notifies organization-defined personnel or roles of failed security verification tests;
    • objective: {{si-6.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-6.d_obj.1}} - the organization defines alternative action(s) to be performed when anomalies are discovered;
      • objective: {{si-6.d_obj.2}} - the information system performs one or more of the following actions when anomalies are discovered:
        • objective: {{si-6.d_obj.2.a}} - shuts the information system down;
        • objective: {{si-6.d_obj.2.b}} - restarts the information system; and/or
        • objective: {{si-6.d_obj.2.c}} - performs organization-defined alternative action(s).

securityControls.title: si-13 - Predictable Failure Prevention
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-13_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{si-13_smt.a}} - Determines mean time to failure (MTTF) for {{ si-13_prm_1 }} in specific environments of operation; and
    • item: {{si-13_smt.b}} - Provides substitute information system components and a means to exchange active and standby components at {{ si-13_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{si-13_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{si-13.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-13.a_obj.1}} - defines information system components for which mean time to failure (MTTF) should be determined;
      • objective: {{si-13.a_obj.2}} - determines MTTF for organization-defined information system components in specific environments of operation;
    • objective: {{si-13.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-13.b_obj.1}} - defines MTTF substitution criteria to be used as a means to exchange active and standby components;
      • objective: {{si-13.b_obj.2}} - provides substitute information system components at organization-defined MTTF substitution criteria; and
      • objective: {{si-13.b_obj.3}} - provides a means to exchange active and standby components at organization-defined MTTF substitution criteria.

    • #cp-10, related
    • #ma-6, related

    • objective: {{si-13.1_obj.2}} - takes the information system component out of service by transferring component responsibilities to substitute components no later than organization-defined fraction or percentage of mean time to failure.

    • objective: {{si-13.3_obj.2}} - defines the time period that the mean time to failure must exceed before the organization manually initiates a transfer between active and standby information system components; and
    • objective: {{si-13.3_obj.3}} - manually initiates transfers between active and standby information system components at the organization-defined frequency if the mean time to failure exceeds the organization-defined time period.

• ID: {{si-13.4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization, if information system component failures are detected:

    • item: {{si-13.4_smt.b}} - {{ si-13.4_prm_2 }}.
  • ID: {{si-13.4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

      • objective: {{si-13.4.a_obj.2}} - ensures that the standby components are successfully and transparently installed within the organization-defined time period;
    • objective: {{si-13.4.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{si-13.4.b_obj.1}} - defines an alarm to be activated when information system component failures are detected;
      • objective: {{si-13.4.b_obj.2}} - if information system component failures are detected, does one or more of the following:
        • objective: {{si-13.4.b_obj.2.a}} - activates the organization-defined alarm; and/or
        • objective: {{si-13.4.b_obj.2.b}} - automatically shuts down the information system.


  • Guidance

Parameters
{{si-13.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined time period
si-13.4_prm_2, How Many: one or moreactivates {{ si-13.4_prm_3 }} , automatically shuts down the information system,
{{si-13.4_prm_3}}: organization-defined alarm

securityControls.title: pm-1 - Information Security Program Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.a}} - Develops and disseminates an organization-wide information security program plan that:
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.1}} - Provides an overview of the requirements for the security program and a description of the security program management controls and common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.2}} - Includes the identification and assignment of roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.3}} - Reflects coordination among organizational entities responsible for the different aspects of information security (i.e., technical, physical, personnel, cyber-physical); and
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.4}} - Is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.b}} - Reviews the organization-wide information security program plan {{ pm-1_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.c}} - Updates the plan to address organizational changes and problems identified during plan implementation or security control assessments; and
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.d}} - Protects the information security program plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.
  • ID: {{pm-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-1.a_obj}} - develops and disseminates an organization-wide information security program plan that:
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.1}} - provides an overview of the requirements for the security program;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2}} - provides a description of the:
          • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2.a}} - security program management controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
          • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2.b}} - common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj}} - includes the identification and assignment of:
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.1}} - roles;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.2}} - responsibilities;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.3}} - management commitment;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.4}} - coordination among organizational entities;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.5}} - compliance;
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.3_obj}} - reflects coordination among organizational entities responsible for the different aspects of information security (i.e., technical, physical, personnel, cyber-physical);
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.4_obj}} - is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations, organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
    • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review the security program plan for the information system;
      • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj.2}} - reviews the organization-wide information security program plan with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj}} - updates the plan to address organizational:
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.1}} - changes identified during plan implementation;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.2}} - changes identified during security control assessments;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.3}} - problems identified during plan implementation;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.4}} - problems identified during security control assessments;
    • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj}} - protects the information security program plan from unauthorized:
      • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj.1}} - disclosure; and
      • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj.2}} - modification.


  • Guidance
    • #pm-8, related
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{pm-1_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for information security program plan development/review/update/approval automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing the information security program plan

securityControls.title: pm-2 - Senior Information Security Officer
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization appoints a senior information security officer with the mission and resources to coordinate, develop, implement, and maintain an organization-wide information security program.
  • ID: {{pm-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization appoints a senior information security officer with the mission and resources to:
    • objective: {{pm-2_obj.1}} - coordinate an organization-wide information security program;
    • objective: {{pm-2_obj.2}} - develop an organization-wide information security program;
    • objective: {{pm-2_obj.3}} - implement an organization-wide information security program; and
    • objective: {{pm-2_obj.4}} - maintain an organization-wide information security program.


  • Guidance
securityControls.assessmentPlan:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: INTERVIEW
      • Organizational personnel with information security program planning and plan implementation responsibilities senior information security officer organizational personnel with information security responsibilities

securityControls.title: pm-3 - Information Security Resources
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-3_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-3_smt.a}} - Ensures that all capital planning and investment requests include the resources needed to implement the information security program and documents all exceptions to this requirement;
    • item: {{pm-3_smt.b}} - Employs a business case/Exhibit 300/Exhibit 53 to record the resources required; and
    • item: {{pm-3_smt.c}} - Ensures that information security resources are available for expenditure as planned.
  • ID: {{pm-3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-3.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{pm-3.a_obj.1}} - ensures that all capital planning and investment requests include the resources needed to implement the information security program plan;
      • objective: {{pm-3.a_obj.2}} - documents all exceptions to the requirement;

securityControls.title: pm-4 - Plan of Action and Milestones Process
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-4_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-4_smt.a}} - Implements a process for ensuring that plans of action and milestones for the security program and associated organizational information systems:
      • item: {{pm-4_smt.a.1}} - Are developed and maintained;
      • item: {{pm-4_smt.a.2}} - Document the remedial information security actions to adequately respond to risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation; and
      • item: {{pm-4_smt.a.3}} - Are reported in accordance with OMB FISMA reporting requirements.
    • item: {{pm-4_smt.b}} - Reviews plans of action and milestones for consistency with the organizational risk management strategy and organization-wide priorities for risk response actions.
  • ID: {{pm-4_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-4.a_obj}} - implements a process for ensuring that plans of action and milestones for the security program and associated organizational information systems:
      • objective: {{pm-4.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{pm-4.a.1_obj.1}} - are developed;
        • objective: {{pm-4.a.1_obj.2}} - are maintained;
      • objective: {{pm-4.a.2_obj}} - document the remedial information security actions to adequately respond to risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
      • objective: {{pm-4.a.3_obj}} - are reported in accordance with OMB FISMA reporting requirements;
    • objective: {{pm-4.b_obj}} - reviews plans of action and milestones for consistency with:
      • objective: {{pm-4.b_obj.1}} - the organizational risk management strategy; and
      • objective: {{pm-4.b_obj.2}} - organization-wide priorities for risk response actions.

securityControls.title: pm-9 - Risk Management Strategy
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-9_smt.a}} - Develops a comprehensive strategy to manage risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation associated with the operation and use of information systems;
    • item: {{pm-9_smt.b}} - Implements the risk management strategy consistently across the organization; and
    • item: {{pm-9_smt.c}} - Reviews and updates the risk management strategy {{ pm-9_prm_1 }} or as required, to address organizational changes.
  • ID: {{pm-9_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-9.a_obj}} - develops a comprehensive strategy to manage risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation associated with the operation and use of information systems;
    • objective: {{pm-9.b_obj}} - implements the risk management strategy consistently across the organization;
    • objective: {{pm-9.c_obj}}
      • objective: {{pm-9.c_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the risk management strategy;
      • objective: {{pm-9.c_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the risk management strategy to address organizational changes:
        • objective: {{pm-9.c_obj.2.a}} - with the organization-defined frequency; or
        • objective: {{pm-9.c_obj.2.b}} - as required.

securityControls.title: pm-10 - Security Authorization Process
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-10_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-10_smt.a}} - Manages (i.e., documents, tracks, and reports) the security state of organizational information systems and the environments in which those systems operate through security authorization processes;
    • item: {{pm-10_smt.b}} - Designates individuals to fulfill specific roles and responsibilities within the organizational risk management process; and
    • item: {{pm-10_smt.c}} - Fully integrates the security authorization processes into an organization-wide risk management program.
  • ID: {{pm-10_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-10.a_obj}} - manages (i.e., documents, tracks, and reports) the security state of organizational information systems and the environments in which those systems operate through security authorization processes;
